Reviews.Title: “great location and amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: AndyrooMac
Reviews.Content: you really cant ask for a better location with easy walking access to times, 5th and empire as well as the subway... everything else in the area is nearly double the price, so, whilst it aint no palace its clean and tidy, the staff are helpful and it's toasty warm in winter...

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! PLEASE READ MY REVIEW.”
Reviews.Author: Mike0347
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting a palace but this place was a disgrace. Typically, hotel rooms are no big deal to me because I merely sleep there. However, I believe as a hotel, it should be condemned. It had a filthy carpet, stained walls, broken night lamp, broken old-fashioned tv, flea market furniture, no a/c or fan, small and few towels, dangerous uncovered steam radiator, dim lighting, lumpy bed, very weak shower pressure and the walls were painted different colors. How they do business is beyond me. There are better hotels for the same money. It is so awful I intend to contact the NY dept of consumer affairs. Save time, money, and stress. STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “A dusty old ramshackle hotel with an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: USCHazDan
Reviews.Content: I did not come to NYC to see the inside of a hotel, and as such, the St. James provided everything I needed for my stay. For the money, you cannot beat this location! There is a nice cafe next door where I had breakfast each morning. Times square is a block away, and you're convenient to a number of metro lines. The hotel staff was friendly enough, and my room was always clean. The hotel itself is old. The rooms and elevators had a dusty smell, and the carpet and furniture are past their prime. But, the neighborhood is safe, the bed was comfortable, the room was quiet (10th floor), and the shower was hot. I couldn't ask for much more. I will certainly stay here again, and would recommend to anyone who wants to stay in NYC on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: Ronald L
Reviews.Content: I can't say this enough, but the location of this hotel is AWESOME! 2 mins walk to Times Square and that's where all the actions are! You can walk to the Times Square subway station within 10 mins. The hotel itself is old, but clean. Rooms are very very basic, but it has everything that gets you through your stay. The staffs are nice and friendly. Most importantly, it cost a fractions of what other hotels are offering in NYC. If you're travelling with a budget, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: AKAMBERZ
Reviews.Content: A simple hotel. Rooms are small but clean. Great location. Close to Times Square, the Theater District and many great sites are within walking distance. The Cranberry Deli next door is great for morning coffee and the late night munchies! I left an item in the room and the staff was simply fantastic about arranging to get it sent to me. If you're there to enjoy the city and don't want to blow the budget on a room...this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: UncleAlbert_10
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed here for a weekend. Booked through Expedia and got a reduced rate for a 4 night stay. We were on 45th St less than 5 min walk from Times Square so at the heart of all the action. As said previously the hotel itself is very basic, definitely no airs and graces and the rooms are tired and dated. However, most importantly the rooms were clean and no bedbugs!!! There are no facilities at the hotel but two doors away the Cranberry Deli offers an exhaustive range of good value food and is open 24 hours a day. We wanted a good value hotel in an awesome location and this is what we got. If you, like us, just need a hotel to lay your head down after spending all day and night in the Big Apple, then this is your place. Would recommend and stay again. Also do try and get a meal at the Bond 45 restaurant just across the road from the hotel - the food was amazing!!! P.S. Don't forget your earplugs, the downside to the location is that it can be noisy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: terps9498
Reviews.Content: The St. James is in the heart of NY's Theatre district. So many great sites are in walking distance! So if you want an affordable hotel in an awesome location this is your place but if you're one to stay in your room and not go anywhere this is not the hotel for you. Rooms were clean but small. Hotel has no ammenities except free wifi but what do you need with so much else to see?

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Very basic hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: bazzamac29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and although the hotel is very basic its excellent value for the great location. Its up 1 block from Time Square and close to the Rockefella centre, Central Park and Broadway so it really is a great place as a base for exploring. Staff were helpful and beds were clean so if you want cheap accomodation so you've got more money to spend enjoying NY - then this is the place for you!! Really good deli next door as well - Cranberry deli, does great coffee and snacks

Reviews.Title: “Met my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: sasha51
Reviews.Content: When a place meets my expectations I would say it's very good. I expected a great location which it is, so close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. I expected a nice room for a reasonably low price which I got. And more so, unlike what others said, I found the front desk staff to be welcoming and helpful. Appreciated the recommendations here for a back room which I got and it was quiet. I did not expect any amenities or fancy lobby, restaurant and there weren't any; example, if you want air conditioning - open the window. So if you really are just looking at a hotel as a place to sleep and spending most of your money not on the hotel but touring this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Worth of value”
Reviews.Author: Marra27
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good beds and clean room. Though I can imagine that in summer time the room will be super hot and uncomfortable since it was quite hot even now in winter. There was extremely friendly and helpful man working in the reception, thanks to him! Overall I think this hotel is pretty well worth of it's cost since New York hotels are so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location and price”
Reviews.Author: Townhaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near Times Square and is a remodeled older hotel. The rooms are fairly small, however mine was fine and even had a little table. The bathroom was redone and quite nice. This hotel is very inexpensive for New York City, so travelers should not expect luxury. In this case I think you don't just get what you paid for, but get better than that. If you are looking for bigger rooms, better amenities you can find them in New York for a lot more money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: borninqueens
Reviews.Content: We found the St. James to be comfortable and friendly for a four-night stay. Had I been paying $250 or more, I might have objected to some shabbiness, thin towels, and the intermittent hot water supply, but for $128, it was a miracle: a quiet, decent-sized room in midtown, comfortable new bed, friendly, helpful staff, new bathroom (except for the spotty hot water ...), and a great location. For the price, this was excellent. If you insist on all the amenities of big 4-star chains, go elsewhere and pay twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: baby10660
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my experience at Hotel St. James. The room was in great condition and clean. The concierge service was very helpful. They got us great seats for Chicago (4 rows from the stage) at a heavily discounted rate. I cannot say enough about the location of this hotel. It is literally about 70 steps away from Times Square. There are many delis and restaurants around the hotel. Dunhill Cafe and Cranberry Cafe next door serve up some really good New York style food. Europa Cafe, around the corner, had an OUTSTANDING salad bar and great lunch choices. We could walk to Rockefeller Plaza and also to Central Park. The subway is very close. The staff was very helpful. My flight landed at 4 am and I got to the hotel at 6 am. Although the check-in time was 3 pm they had me in a room by 8 am. The room was in the back of the hotel. I highly recommend that as you will not get the intense street sounds in the back. And the free WiFi rocks! Overall, a great choice. I will book there again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: suga_8
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights had a good time.a bit dated but didnt matter to me .helpful staff.great deli right next door with good prices ,always full which is a good sign,good stay basic but good ,

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy experience”
Reviews.Author: 27cc
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed one night in this hotel. When it was time to go out & see new York I didn't feel comfortable carrying my passport & money so kindly asked the front desk agent to put it in their safe.. Only to be told they DIDNT have one...now I was extremely worried but reluctantly left it behind anyways..then I asked how to catch the dbl decker sightseeing bus.. the front desk agent pointed across the room to a young lady sitting behind a little booth. I approached the young woman & bought 2 bus tickets. When I asked her where to catch the bus she seemed unable to answer me.. Then gave us completly misguided directions. Whereas it took us almost an hour to find the area to catch it.. Once back at the hotel AGAIN we asked the front desk agent where a good place to eat would be & he directed us to Bond 45 across the street.. Again bad choice.. It was like eating food that had been run over by a car..later when back at the hotel & in our room. I noticed the room faced an office building.. With no view & the carpet by the window, to me appeared to have been laid by an inexperienced layman it looked like someone butchered it with an exacto knife. I work in a very nice hotel in my home town & let me tell you it puts this hotel to shame & readers at $268.00 a night they didn't even offer a shuttle service or continental breakfast. I may sound picky but at this price you'd think they'd offer something!! Even when we were checking out the front desk agent seemed more concerned that we were only staying the one night & didn't even ask if we enjoyed our stay.. Something my hotel where I work always makes sure to ask! I plan to bring my daughter ( & 2 sons whose never experienced New York) to New York very soon & trust me I WONT be staying at this hotel..and really don't advise anyone else new to New York to do either! This was my our very unhappy experience!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Mcbeaty
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms are clean! Staff smiled and seemed happy. Hall noice was not notice able. Could use a few more outlets to handle today's gadgets. Water pressure was fine. Location was excellent and I didn't have to get a cab after seeing three plays! Recommend for location and low cost!

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Margarita1212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. James for six nights before Christmas and it was the perfect hotel for me. I saw six Broadway shows and staying at the St. James allowed me to walk to all the theaters. No cab fares! I paid less than $100.00 per night, which is unbelievably low. The hotel is very similar to an older, two-star hotel in Europe. So, if you've traveled to Europe and were happy to stay in an older family-run hotel, the St. James will hold no surprises. The room is comfortable and, most important, clean. The bathroom, sheets, towels, all clean. Yes, the furniture is worn and the elevator needs to be refurbished, but this does not affect the quality of your stay. It is economical, clean and convenient. Do you really need and ice machine down the hall? Do you really need room service and a coffee maker? If you don't care about these conveniences, the Hotel St. James is a great budget choice. Also, the front desk staff was very good, particularly Joey. He was extremely professional, friendly and helpful...an asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: jason w
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the money. It is not fancy and does not have fancy furniture in the rooms or even any pictures on the walls. However, the price and location make up for everything that is missing. The staff was very friendly and they were very accomodating to us when we showed up for an unscheduled early check-in. They were also quick to assist us after our son locked us out of our bathroom. As most of the reviews state, don't stay here if you are a hotel snob, you will not like it! But if you are looking for a clean, warm inexpensive place near Times Square, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see New York”
Reviews.Author: Buksie
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel room holiday, this is not the place for you. This is a place to sleep while you explore New York. I also don't think the location can be beaten, not for that price. The staff was not very welcoming, friendly or helpful. they themselves seem to be travellers having a part time job, and to be honest, I think the creatures that probably have showed up there made the staff callus. The room were we're in were on the east side. Noisy, pipes dangling, early morning rubbish and delivery trucks, etc. But within minutes of waking up and cleaning up, we were in the middle of New York exploring. I was prepared to put up with the room annoyances for the convenience of being a few steps from Time Square. I'd stay there again, and remember my earplugs this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: BestKind
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews like a savage before my trip in early December so I thought it my duty to now write one of my own. Like the other reviews say - this is a no frills hotel but if you'd rather spend you money on new boots at Macy's than on a hotel room - stay here. It is clean. Beds were clean, tidy and comfy. There is a TV with cable. Bathroom is spotless. That's all you need, right? If you just want to be assured a clean spot to lay your head, this is the place. The water temperature isn't the greatest but just take quick showers. You've got shopping to do anyway! There is no thermostat (just old hot water radiators) but we found the temperature just fine. Our first room had a broken radiator and was on the front of the building (VERY VERY noisy). We asked to switch rooms the next morning and the staff were more than happy to oblige. We were given a selection of 3 different rooms even though the hotel was booked solid (we asked to switch early in the morning). The second room also needed a radiator repair but a repairman showed up within 15 minutes and fixed it no problem. All is all, it's clean and simple. Location just can't be beat for the price. If you are easy going, stay here. If you like things a certain way, do stay elsewhere. Save your money for other things New York has to offer besides the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Cake
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews here are pretty accurate. You don't stay at the St. James for luxury. You stay here because it's cheap & just steps away from Times Square. Seriously, the Marriott Marquis is a block away, and the rooms are more than double the price. What you'll get: - a somewhat clean room for your basic needs - a room key that needs to be turned in when you leave - a fabulous location for a great price - free wifi (this is a pleaser for me) What you won't get: - ice - lobby bar - comfie pillows - luxury bedding (it's the foam stuff) - water pressure - a thermostat I know it sounds like the Con's are steep, but really are they worth an extra $200.00 a night? Not for me. Check in was easy, although Mr Clean is a bit of a nasty! He was just so unpleasant when we checked in - he needs to back to hospitality school. But the day crew people were fantastic & nice. There was a shuttle leaving every 2 hours for the airport (3rd party & $22.00 to JFK). All in all, I'll stay here again and spend my saved $200.00 over at Michael Jordan's Steak House, or at a Broadway Play (which is an easy walk).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKazza
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. Keep the blinds closed as there is nothing to look at out the window. It was warm and comfortable. Plenty of room for me and all my shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel for the price, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Star111980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, one block from Times Square. It is a very basic hotel that just met our needs. It was reasonably priced for its location. The room was spacious enough and even though it was December the room stayed warm even at night. They let us check in early and when we checked out and had 5 hrs before we left for the airport they allowed us to hang out in their very comfy lounge. If we didn't want to hang out they did have lockers for $5 each which fits one suitcase per locker. Some people are complaining about having to turn in the key when you leave each day and picking it up when you are going back to the room but I preferred it because you knew that you didn't leave it in the room and you didn't have to worry about losing out. They have 2 cafe/deli places next door which were convenient. We were within walking distance of most of the stuff we wanted to do. For the other stuff we took a 2 day bus tour which was 2 blocks from the hotel. I would recommend bringing earplugs as the windows did not keep out the sounds and it is a busy street. They have a booth a the hotel that you can book stuff at, we booked our shuttle back to the airport and it worked out great. I am not sure how this hotel would be in the summer as it didn't have any air conditioner. If visiting in December bring an umbrella and clothing to layer as it can get cold. We wore tights under our jeans and had tooks, gloves etc. We flew a direct flight with Cathay Pacific from Vancouver and it worked out great. Buy the city pass if you are planning on visiting all the sites and try to get broadway tickets in Times Square at tkts if you are willing to wait in line. Enjoy New York, what a great place to visit!!

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the worst i have ever experienced. very tinny rooms broken furniture and dirty. i would never go there.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in New York”
Reviews.Author: M_BR1986
Reviews.Content: Hotel 5 minutes walk from Times Square. Big rooms for Manhattan, very clean. Comfortable bed and nice staff. Excellent value for the price, totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TimboTexan
Reviews.Content: BARE bones rooms..... TV, bathroom , bed. ......no charm, no nada. But alas, a step outside awaits crazy ol' NYC. So, if you wanna avoid cabs and subway rides with no frills...you got it. Cool deli next stores with fresh made bagel sandwiches. the staff at the front desk was actually quite nice despite reading some other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this place”
Reviews.Author: HarrietteTaylor
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here - the location is great but that's it. The staff are arrogant, rude and completely unhelpful. The place is dirty and worn. (tub was cleanest place in the room) This was my travel companion's first trip to NYC and I booked the room. SO sorry I did that.The experience was so bad. Pay a little more and get a room with a safe, lamps and an ice bucket and maybe even a coffee pot. These rooms haven't been updated since Hitler was a corporal.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yves P
Reviews.Content: Terrible, horrible! It was my worst experience in a hotel!!!!! First, check-in by arrogant, rude and non professional guy. I feel that i was disturbing him, or he dont want to work. No greeting, no smile, NOTHING!!!!! There was dead big bugs in the stairs...The room was small, noisy, to hot, the floor was not vacum, I found piece of i dont know what on the floor....NO hot water. I call for a technician, i NEVER come, i'll call back, the receptionist hang up on me...Finally a guy came. He didnt know what to do, after 10 minutes just playing with the handle of the shower I ask him to leave...They didn't fix it and they DONT CARE! Dont go there it's terrible! The only good thing is the location of the hotel. They are all wrong! SO BAD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: Tiemileal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St. James Hotel three times with my family (four people) and we loved everything about it. The location in my opinion is the best feature of the hotel, a 5 minutes walk from Times Square. The staff were amazing, seriously they were always so attentive with our needs. The rooms are very simple but also very cozy. The bathrooms are quite small but well cleaned. Well in general I think the hotel it is a perfect and affordable option ! I will definitely stay there again for the fourth time and I also recommend this hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelerst18
Reviews.Content: All of my expectations were exceeded at the Hotel St. James. The room was very clean, I would guess recently renovated and safe. The service was quick and efficient. A light bulb needed replacing in my room and it was replaced before I got back to my room. I was surprised how quiet the room was for being so close to Times Square. I was able to adjust the radiator heat in the room very easily when needed. The two deli's right next door were a great convenience. The lockers in the hotel are great if you have a late flight. You can store your luggage for $5 for 24 hours. I picked this hotel for the great location and was really pleased with the hotel as well. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “More a 3* hostel than hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley H
Reviews.Content: The only reason I am giving this place any stars at all is the location, it's extremely central (5 mins walk to Times Square) apart from that there is nothing I can say nice about this place! As soon as as we arrived we were greeted by a fellow guest complaining about how disgusting the hotel was and how unhelpful the staff were. We were then handed our key and asked to hand oover card details for anything that we may use in hotel - not sure why as you can't buy anything there and there is no bar! After clambering into a lift whIch was covered in old dust curtains we arrived at our floor, walking past the cleaner we were greeted outside our room with a dirty toilet brush on the floor just by our doorway. Room was small but they all a in NYC, the wardrobe was the smallest thing I had ever seen, bed was tiny and a double ( we booked 2 singles) furniture was worn and tired with scratches all over it. There was blood marks on the wall and no air conditioning so we had to wedge open the window and put up with the sound of NYC at night which is loud and full of sirens. Radiator ( that was supported 1 side by wooden blocks) was blasting out heat and the pipes in the bathroom were rattling all night. Bathroom was small but clean but again roasting hot with exposed hot pipes, thankfully we never had out children with us so no one got burned! One night was enough even though we booked for 3, we immediately packed up quickly and left early the next morning. We informed reception that we were not impressed and it is nothing like the images online but they did not care as room had been paid in full as we booked through a travel agent, they took our key and that was that, no question of what was wrong etc....... I would avoid this place like the plague, the hotel online looks ok but believe me it's nothing like that when you get there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Barthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November for 3 nights. The check in was quick and easy. Our room was nice and clean, I think we may have had one of the renovated rooms. We had no view but we weren't going to be staying in the room all day. I found the room to be nice and quiet as well. Every time you leave the room to go exploring you have to leave your room key with the front office, so we had to try and remember that. They dont have parking, but you dont need a car to get around NYC. Taxis and subway are at your door step. They have internet downstairs in the foyer area and its a couple of dollars to use. The hotel is about 2 mins walk to the middle of times square! The deli next door to the hotel is called Cafe Cranberry and me being a vegetarian they make the best vegetarian omlettes I have ever had! I still miss them to this day. We had breaky there each morning and it was so cheap and great! If you are looking for a place to stay in NYC that is cheap and close to everything I would recommend staying here. It isn't 5 star, but it is a good clean 2 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: friedmaters
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC and I choose Hotel St. James because of the price and location. I booked through priceline.com. We were very pleased. The rooms are small but I did not go to NY to lay around a hotel room I simply needed a place to stay. The bathroom seemed to be brand new and super clean! It was a surprise to receive a real key upon check in! They said they are in the process of getting card locks but I enjoyed the key. When we left the hotel we just left the key with the man at the front desk which was great, I did not have to worry about loosing it. This is a very old hotel but was clean (July 2011) and steps away from Time Square. Great value for the money and a great way to brag... It is the hotel Tom Hanks was in, in the movie "Big".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Furniture Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: PAJAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend with my wife and daughters. The hotel location is fantastic - theater district, a few blocks from Rockefeller Plaza, St. Pat's Cathedral, etc. No parking here, but there is a garage across the street as well as another a block away. Check in fast and trouble free. People at front desk nice and willing to help you with attactions. Lobby nice, elevators could use updating (no biggie). Our room was larger than I anticipated actually for NYC. 2 double beds, bathroom (tub). Room and bath were recently refurbished, however, they could use a few more paintings on the walls as they were mostly bare. The dressers were pretty beat (chunks missing out of them), TV was an old tube style that sat on the dresser. Beds were comfortable, towels were decent as well. Room was quiet, but it was bright inside at night due to the office building next door. It fit our needs as a place to sleep for the night, and you couldn't beat the cost and location. Our initial impression was "we're not too thrilled with it", but that changed when we realized we saved $200 a night over other places in NYC, and the real only negative part of the room was the dressers being scratched/gouged. Again, location is great. Gave it a 2 due to this. If the furniture was replaced, a solid 3+.

Reviews.Title: “Plain,, clean, well centered”
Reviews.Author: ottawatraveler50
Reviews.Content: Was in New York City from 20 to 23 Nov 2011. Hotel was what I had expected from reviews I had read. Hotel is not a 5 star but yet was very clean. We had a room facing the back of the street, no view to be had, but then again, we were only there to sleep so who cares. Staff was extremely friendly. For the price, can't complain. I was there with my sister and had requested a room with 2 beds and sure enough we had what we requested. There is a Starbucks across the street and 2 delis right besides the hotel. Like I said, very clean hotel, well localized, one block from Times Square. The hotel is old but yet very functional. Would go back. Shaun - Ottawa

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: IndoenFrance
Reviews.Content: We were so happy choose this hotel, considering it was the first time our visit to New York. We booked this hotel by internet so we have no idea at all how it will be the hotel. When we arrived there, the room was not so big, but because we just only 2, so it was no problem at all. The bathroom big enough and clean! That's the most important for us. We got calm room so we can sleep nicely. The receptionists are very welcome too. Thanks guys!! They have internet and we can print anytime we want. If we want to have tours, they ready to help. For the breakfast? They don't have it, but no worries at all cause just the next door, there are some shops that provide breakfast for the people around there. Finally for the location? It's perfect, just need 3 minutes walk to Times Square and you are there! With all the lamps, big screen tv and shops! So if you looking honeymoon hotel, this is not the place. But if you looking the hotel for sleep, for discover the New York City, right in downtown and clean, we can suggest you this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - One Block from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: gpotvin
Reviews.Content: The location is the primary reason we chose this hotel and we were pleased at how easy it was to get around Manhattan from here. It was a bit noisy with people coming and going into the wee hours of the morning. The rooms are small and the hotel is a bit tired, but generally clean, especially the bathrooms which appear to have been recently remodeled. Hot water was a bit of a problem - it was merely luke warm after 8:00 a.m., but was quite hot if you got up early. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Liz0719
Reviews.Content: A great "no-frills" hotel at an unbeatable price for Manhattan, in an excellent location for seeing the sights. The room, although small, was clean and the bathroom updated. In the room, there were not too many places to charge phones or camera batteries, so if you have a lot of things to charge, bringing a power strip may be a good idea. The staff was very polite and helpful. We loved that, in the lobby, there are huge lockers that fit 2 small suitcases each, for $5 a day, so we could spend our entire check-out day in the city and not worry about our luggage. Only drawback for us was that our windows faced a concrete wall, but a good thing about that was that it blocked the city noises at night! Also no restaurant, but plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith P
Reviews.Content: I've been to NYC on average once a year and have stayed in a wide range of hotels. This for the price and location was the best. Rooms were a good size, they were very very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The only complaint would be being on the 9th floor the wi-fi didnt have great reception. Will defintely go back to this hotel. Keith

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherJ902
Reviews.Content: The price and location was what brought us here, but the service, and value will keep us returning. I loved the old charm of this hotel. The entrance, lobby and marble stairwells had a lot of character. The carpet in the hallways on the floors needs some replacing, however, but the rooms themselves were fine. The front desk staff were very friendly and obliging to accommodate our group getting all three rooms on the same floor. The room was a decent size by NY standards. We had plenty of towels. The shampoo bottle and soaps were replaced daily. We were also able to get an iron and ironing board brought to our room. A note that all three rooms were different in size and layout. One even had a little table and chair set under the window, so if you are planning on spending any time in the room or sending someone next door for breakfast take out, that is a bonus you would want to ask for. We could not hear any noise from adjoining rooms but some others could from theirs. There wasn't a clock so you may want to bring one, we just used our cell phone. Head next door to the Dunhill or the Cranberry for breakfast, coffee and whatever else you may want to eat, there is a huge selection! We also appreciated the large storage lockers behind the lobby. Check out was at noon but we headed out for day earlier and were not heading to the airport until 2:00 pm. For $5.00 we stored all 6 suitcases and some shopping bags all day. We were very pleased with this hotel and recommend it highly. We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Liane H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quaint and lovely. We were super central to so many attractions. We met Mark on the front desk upon arrival and discovered we had booked the wrong dates, he was wonderful and took great care to find us the best room available and it was a welcome thing at midnight after many hours flying to meet great people! Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LucianaCampos
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at times square, it's a walking distance from all the main attractions, all the broadway shows and great restaurantes are around. It's an old hotel but very comfortable and clean, the reception was very good in helping to guide us, there's no breakfast but there are 2 bakeries just besides the hotel, there are safety lockers where you can leave your stuff to travell to other cities and then come back. Toilest are small and very old but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy J
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay during the NY City Marathon. This hotel is an excellent bargain for the price, location, friendliness of staff, and cleanliness of room. The bathroom is very small but adequate. The lightbulb went out the first night and the response to fix was fast and courteous. The front desk staff were friendly and it was nice to have to leave the key at the desk and not have to worry about losing it. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JJFGB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 7 night stay and was attracted by the good reviews combined with its reasonable prices. For the price, this is a great hotel and is conveniently located being less than a block from Times Square. My room was a good size and was both clean and well maintained. Although the room overlooked the central courtyard, this was not a problem and in fact meant I was not plagued by street noise. There was plenty of power points for charging laptops, phones etc and indeed free wifi. The staff were really friendly and very helpful. The only minor negative is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room but at the price they charge, isn't a problem. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, good value hotel in the heart of the city. One final tip, do check out the Cranberry Deli Cafe next door, the food is excellent and competitively priced.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit”
Reviews.Author: berylvoss
Reviews.Content: Why do we keep going back? Mostly because of the location... it could hardly be better. We've just spent 4 nights there again. This time, we had a room looking out on W45th Street and there was hardly any noise even with the window slightly open. Don't be dismayed when you enter your room... it's quite plain and has no semblance of style. However, it's clean and the bathroom is just fine. We'll probably stay there on our next trip to NYC. Oh! And they now have free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but OK for the location”
Reviews.Author: eddy621
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in october 2011. It's a slightly ageing building that is starting to need a re-furbish. Our room on the 8th floor had enough space and the bathroom was ok. Outside the window though was a wall. To see the weather you had to open the window and look up the rest of the floors to see. Having said that it was a reasonably quiet room. To get the big floor to ceiling windows you would need to be in another hotel with the prices that goes with it! We stayed during October so we didn't need the A/C, though the room was quite warm (for me), in the summer it could possibly be a bit stuffy. It's main asset by far is it's location, less than 2 minutes to Times Square. The staff were OK as especially Joe on reception. Outside there are plenty of eating places within a 2 minute walk (and thats a lot on America). It maiy cost quite a bit to stay here but for this location its the cheapest about as i surfed a lot looking. There is left luggage lockers that will take 2 good sized suitcases each for $5 for 24 hours which is a good thing if you have to book out but your flight is much later in the day. I would stay here again as it's location is great. Standard wise it's better than a budget hotel but not luxurious. Anyway you're in NY you shouldn't be spending your time in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Exellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tiff49
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at a decent price, perfect location, rooms are small but clean bathroom. Lockers for $5.00 to leave your luggage after or before you check in, this is my hotel from now on when in NYC, and thanks to Joey for the friendly service..:)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Begley071902
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 1/2 block from Times Square. It has old time charm, and isn't very modern but it was very clean and the entire staff was very friendly. The room itself is small, but the bathroom is big. The bed and pillows were ok, but for the price and location you can't beat it. There was a musty smell the first time we got off of the elevator on our floor, but once you got into the room you could not smell it. If you want a large, fancy hotel room, this hotel isn't for you. But we were in NYC to sightsee not spend our time in a hotel room, so if you want a nice room, great location and decent price for NYC then I would recommend Hotel St James.

Reviews.Title: “What do you want in a hotel room?”
Reviews.Author: Ocysu
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a no frills, clean hotel room, in a good NYC location, and at a decent price then the St James is for you. Be forewarned, there is no ice machine, no in room coffee, only one small bottle of shampoo provided, but..... This hotel is very close the Times Square. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms vary. We had a basic room with no view, and the blinds were pretty "trashed". My traveling companions, who paid the same price, had a much better room, with much better furniture and a bay window. Another pair of traveling companions had a fireplace in their room. Who knows how it is decided who is put into what room. All the bathrooms in our group's rooms did not have a place to put toiletries. If you want fancy, with a great view, lots of amenities, etc. do not book at the St. James. If you are not going to be in your room that much, and just need a clean bed and bath I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: cdavisKansas
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at Hotel St. James and were very pleased with it. The room was small with only a view of a brick wall, but it was very clean. It took awhile for the hot water to get to the 9th floor but it was very hot eventually. We were only a block from Times Square. The tour buses were quite near, too. There was a great deli next door and a Starbucks across the street. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurib0771
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at a very good location. It was close to Times Square and close to subway stations and parking, so we could walk everywhere. The hotel is older, but our room and bathroom were very clean. We had no problems at all. I would stay here again due to location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Southernese
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a half block from Times Square. It is in a very old building and it hasn't been updated. It is VERY CLEAN! There's no coffeemaker, no cold drink machines, no ice machine in the hotel. The rooms have window air conditioners and steam radiators. The furniture is cheap and chipped. The beds are clean and fairly comfortable. An extra blanket would have been good to have. The staff was very friendly. The lockers were really useful,I'd rather have that than just leave my luggage with the bellman(oh,no bellman, this is do it yourself) If you are looking for the Hyatt,this is not it. But we had two full beds, the room had a closet with hangers,a hair dryer, and it was big enough. The tv worked and we got basic cable. It is far better than another hotel I stayed in in NYC once. I was with a friend of mine on this trip,and we felt safe, two women alone in NYC. I would stay here again. No spa :-) No restaurant, although the market next door is great, cheap and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “â€œHidden Gem near Times Squareâ€�”
Reviews.Author: yoyocu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January for three days. Even though the streets were a mess because of the snow, the hotel lobby was very clean and there was a guy there shoveling the snow accumulated in front of the hotel. Our room was spacious, and the bathroom was clean modern. The hotel is old and has a beautiful staircase. The property is in shape and the staff is great. If I ever go to New York again I will surely go to this hotel because it is in middle of everything. Many delis around the property and plenty of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff and I would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: DanR31
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the reviews we read in Tripadvisor and frankly we were not disappointed. The hotel is really well located, we hardly took the subway. The room was clean and the bathroom really comfortable. The AC was very useful :) The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. After check out, they gave us a scale so we can weigh our luggages.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sindrein
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for about a week earlie september. The room was a bit tired, but clean and cosy. The staff were real nice and helpful at all hours, and you can't beat the location at this price and standard.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TripNL
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel just off Times Square. The decor is a little "tired", but it is clean, close to subway and late night delis. It was a great base for our trip. The cleaning staff were very prompt and thorough, and the front desk staff were absolutely wonderful! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff W
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to New York for a finishing High School treat. We spent more time than anticipated in the hotel room due to hurricane Irene. Although it's quite old, we found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. The location is excellent, especially for somebody with reduced mobility such as myself, it being very close to Times Square and a few blocks from several of the iconic attractions. There's a great 24 hour deli next door but one. The reception staff were helpful and responded promptly to an issue with the air con unit. That was due to rain hammering against the metal unit outside the bedroom window which kept us awake one night. The short term fix was for the maintenance man to cover the unit with a towel. We slept soundly thereafter. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a low budget, well located placed to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel , great location , would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn R
Reviews.Content: On arrival the male member of staff who had long hair , checked us in and was less than friendly. The room was small but fine for us. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked well. The location was perfect! Literally less than a 2 minute walk which was very convenient. Having to hand in the keys wasn't a problem to us, as this prevented us from loosing it! We stayed there through Hurricane Irene and the earthquake and it kept us safe so to us that makes it great! The lifts aren't as bad as other reviews have made out. I'm not a huge fan of lifts but I managed to stay calm! The only flaws to the hotel were that most members of staff we'rent particularly friendly and only one spoke good English, the rest were foreign. We found it very unprofessional when some of the staff were drinking alcohol behind the desk, and also sometimes we could see that they were on Facebook & twitter! (Wish we all could get paid for going on our social networking sites!) One member of staff was American and made an effort with all customers and made us laugh when each time we came to collect our key, he'd guess our number and got it wrong every time. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Hotel St James. This hotel is not for anyone who expects a lot, but for those who aren't fussy and just want a inexpensive roof to sleep under!

Reviews.Title: “It's cozy”
Reviews.Author: Klettenberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St. James on July with my parents, children and husband. When we arrived we had a good surprise, although it's wasn't time to check in yet, they allowed us to get one of the rooms. The other wasn't ready, and the staff helped us to choose the better for 4. The location of the hotel is fantastic. The rooms were also very good. The price was unbelievable, the slowest we've found at that neighborhood. Tips: 1) Room 612 is big and comfortable; 2) There is a Duane Reade very close (at Avenue of Americas) with good items for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good no-frills hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: suttonteacher
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to add to the other reviews on here really. Clean basic old-style hotel very close to Time Square.Newly decorated room of reasonably good size, with a comfortable bed, good bedding and white towels.Abundant supply of hot water in the bathroom, which had a shallow bath and shower. The door lock had a knack to it, there were no curtains/blackouts at the windows but blinds, the air conditioning unit was noisy, there were no tea/coffee making facilities or clock and not much of a view from the windows but very good for the price paid.Cranberry deli two doors down very convienient for breakfast or the odd cup of tea/quick snack. Would recommend, unless you want a hotel with the wow factor-in which case pay more and go somewhere like the Sheraton Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St. James gets the job done.”
Reviews.Author: joeysarahm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a mother-daughter trip (first trip to New York City). The hotel is in a GREAT location, convenient to the subway and theater district (we saw "Wicked" the first night of our stay). As others have mentioned, the rooms have actual keys that have to be turned in at/picked up from the front desk, which was a little inconvenient, but the service at the front desk was almost always prompt. Aside from that, the only other bothersome thing was the slow elevators. St. James is nothing fancy and the decor is dated, but for the location and the price, it was exactly what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY_trip_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for at week. Clean rooms, good beds and kind staff. Highly recommended: cheap hotel at a fine lokation in the center og Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.......and price!”
Reviews.Author: greensjunction
Reviews.Content: When it comes to hotel rooms, I'm pretty picky. I've been known to make the hotel clean the carpet or give me another room. I was a little bit concerned when I entered my room at the Hotel St James to find that the blinds on the windows looked like they'd been sucked up by the vacuum and spit back out. But on closer inspection of the room I found that the blinds, and possibly the lack of a view, were the only things to complain about. The bathroom was very clean. The bed was comfortable. Aside from the blinds the room was clean and neatly made. It couldn't be mistaken for a Hilton or Marriot, but cozy. But the location and the price were perfect. Just a stone's throw from the center of Times Square on one side and the Avenue of the Americas on the other. And within walking distance to many of the Broadways shows and a full selection of restaurants. The daytime staff were very helpful and pleasant, the nighttime staff didn't seem to have a smile to spare, but they were accomodating just the same. There are a couple of deli's next door for a quick and inexpensive breakfast or 24 hour snack. I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone on a middle to upper middle class income wanting a taste of New York without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikitaJarmila
Reviews.Content: I think most comments here are way to negative. The beds are pretty small for a two persons room, but it's okay since we booked a normal room - the cheapest option, for only $90 a night per 2 people -. The location is even more than perfect: just walk one street and you're on Times Square! You can walk almost anywhere: central park, times square - obviously -, Rockefeller center, empire state building.. I loved my stay here. I have had Internet all the time, & the people were really nice. Also I see it as a positive thing that you have to leave the key at the lobby - you won't lose it!

Reviews.Title: “Room 211”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: Ok, hotel in a great location! room rates good, room clean and tidy, however our bed was like sleeping on the floor it was that hard. Hotel, run of the mill, nothing out of this world, but you get what you pay for and it was clean. Hotel staff, need a kick up the bottom!! No smiles, no good morning!! not very welcoming, cold attitudes!! GET IT SORTED

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: mikkoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but it has an elevator, private bath, clean room and comfortable beds. What is more you are in the middle of Times Square. And also it has free wifi so you can chat and keep in contacts with your friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: idandmw
Reviews.Content: If you want posh, don,t stay here but if you want decent , clean and very close to times square stay here situated just off times square next to a great pub the perfect pint (food was the best we had on our recent trip) staff very helpful and cheery , great amenities close by Food, subway etc .

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travelmake
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Situated in the heart of Manhattan, close to Times square, all main theatres. Central Park within a short walking distance. Priced moderately for a downtown New York hotel. Amentities are modest, service is good. The interior is showing its age, needs renovation. Wi-fi Internet was very slow, and did not work at all on the first day of our stay. If you stay on upper floors, you would have to choose between their two old, tiny, and squeaky elevators which are often hard to catch and a very narrow and steep staircase. Families with children and older travelers, beware!!! Beds were not comfortable although we are not spoilt and fussy travelers. Would recommend this hotel only if there is no better alternative in the area. We had no other choice because all other hotels in this part of Manhattan had been booked by then.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing else sadly.”
Reviews.Author: raybrahms1964
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel other than its great location. Yes it is only a few minutes walk from Times Square and I know a room is generally only used for sleeping in, but I do expect a little bit of comfort from a room. The actual lobby isn't too bad, but once you step into the elevators everything else is extremely dated. The decor is a couple of decades out of date and the only view we had was of several brick walls. The carpet had a full size iron imprint in the middle of it where a previous guest had put a scalding hot iron on it, there is no fridge, the bed squeaked the moment you sat on it and there was no bar to connect the carpet to the floor tiles in the bathroom. This resulted in very jagged edges and was quite dangerous so beware. Coupled with this some front desk staff who don't even acknowledge you when you hand in your keys let alone speak to you, made this particular stage of our holiday the least pleasant in relation to the standard of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ltcjdc
Reviews.Content: I am ambivalent about the Hotel St. James. We stayed there three nights. As others have said, it's a great location near Times Square. The hotel is well worn- the lobby, the elevators, the hallways, the room carpet, the furniture, the blinds, the window air conditioner--but the bathrooms have been refurbished and are very modern and clean. The beds are narrow, but the bedding is clean. The TVs are now new flat screens. 45th street is very noisy all night, but the AC blocks most the noise. Our door lock was semi broken--it took about 90 seconds of turning back and fourth, like a combination, before it opened. We reported it, but it was not fixed. Very annoying! The hotel kind of reminded me of some two-star hotels we stayed in in Europe. I'm not sure we will stay there again, but it's a bargain if you don't have high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent no frills hotel, right in the middle of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Avsecken
Reviews.Content: I have very little to complain about the St. James hotel. It is on an excellent location - just a 5 minute walk from Times Square, and within walking distance to the Empire State Building, the Grand Central Station and the Central Park. It does not have a restaurant, but the Cranberry Deli, just next door, is a small market and also offers breakfast, lunch, dinner and everything in between. The hotel is not modern or especially beautiful, but is very comfortable and hospitable. The space was OK in the room I stayed in (501), with enough places to put your bags and belongings, and the bathroom was very nice. The TV was new, a flat screen with all the basic channels. However, there was absolutely no view from the window (unless you call a grey brick wall a view). Pigeons cooing bothered me a couple of times, but that was not a problem. The internet was free, available in the room and with a good speed, although it did go down a couple of times, sometimes for several hours. Other than those minor issues, I highly recommend the St. James hotel, if you are willing to save money (it is cheap, considering the prices in NY), and if you are not looking for any extra luxury. I think I would stay there again if I came back to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locationssssss”
Reviews.Author: Damarisbk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, The staff are very helpfull. The locations is near the Times Square. I would like to stay again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Buster1966
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for the first time in May\2011 to watch the Yankees play the Blue Jays. Drove from Toronto (8 hrs) and arrived at the hotel @ 9:30am thinking there was no way our room would be ready.... but to my surprise, it was. The hotel is old but well kept... no fancy amenities here, but the room was clean and comfortable (as was the bathroom). Great location... near Times Square, subway, Central Park, great restaurants and bars:) If you're looking for a convenient location in the heart of of the city, you can't go wrong with Hotel St. James. As for parking.... very expensive... Found a parking garage a block away for the piece of mind (didn't want to attempt to find a street parking spot) and paid $80+ for just over 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “good location, very dated”
Reviews.Author: aschimme
Reviews.Content: The Hotel St. James is in an excellent location. The building, rooms and furnishings are a little dated: window AC, steam radiators, ancient little TV, actual keys to the rooms that youâ€™re asked to leave at the front desk whenever you leave; but the sheets and bathroom are clean. The wifi is free, which is very nice in the age when nothing is free, but it has a weak signal. Honestly, what sets the hotel apart in my mind from other low-budget old hotels is the service. The front desk staff is truly warm and inviting, which for any hotel in NY is rare. So if you're looking for a reasonably priced place with nice staff and don't need a desk or clock radio, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: iamathew
Reviews.Content: I will admit to being a little weary of this hotel before we got there. We were traveling with our 16 and 8 year old sons through four cities (DC, Philly, NY & Boston) with only a couple of days in each city. Location was everything to us in every city and the location and price of this hotel was excellent. This is not the place to stay for people who are snobby about hotels. It is not a fancy place. But it is charming, affordable, located practically right in Times Square and perfectly acceptable for family travelers. Our room (#402) was bigger than I expected after reading various reviews. I'm giving this hotel a very good rating because it worked out perfectly for us. There are undoubtedly some downsides, but none of them overshadowed how glad we were to be in that location. The free internet service was awful and mostly didn't work and when it did, it was so slow it almost wasn't worth it. Neither of the beds in our room were comfortable and the pillows were terrible. One of the beds was actually almost collapsed. The elevators were sometimes a little scary. The air conditioner never actually cooled the room to anything a person would call cool. The hotel itself is a charming little building. We actually had a "view" of the street, so unlike some other reviewers, we were not looking at a wall or an alley. The location is just amazing. We enjoyed going to the Irish pub Connolly's right next door both for dinner with the family and for drinks later when the kids were in bed. There is a Starbucks right down the street and a fruit stand on the corner. Check in and check out was easy. Overall, I would certainly recommend this place to my more easy-going friends who wouldn't mind that it is not The Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for a cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: i970380
Reviews.Content: Less than 1min to Times Square.the reception is helpfull and sympathic.the housekeeping always clean the room and change towels.i will suggest this hotel to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: GDMGDM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights and expected more from the hotel. Several issues with the room that were a nuisance. Wi-fi didn't reach our room and we had to go to lobby or a stairwell to get signal, toilet repeatedly blocked up, shower was lukewarm at best, bed was past due to be uprgraded. No information provided in the room about the local area and where to find certain things (and poor internet coverage made this worse). Obviously it is in a prime location and reasonably priced but lets itself down with poor ammenities and indifferent staff. After a 9 night stay I would expect not to have to give room number and name everytime we came in the hotel to recieve our key. Use it as a base if you want to be in the heart of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean and a lot of character”
Reviews.Author: Angel014
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in Hotel St James for 4 nights - our first trip to New York. Staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is an older hotel but this added to its character. The room that we stayed at was comfortable and roomy - and best of all, it was very clean and we had clean fluffy towels each day. The hotel offerred free Wi-fi which was also a big plus. The location was great. We had breakfast at Cranberry Cafe most of the days and it was very cheap and yummy. My daughter loved the Udon noodles (only available during the day). There are a few Irish bars a few steps away from the hotel and we felt so comfortable leaving the kids (15 and 10 yrs) in the hotel while we visited one of them. Timesquare is just about 50 metres away which was great. We walked to central park from the hotel and this was a comfortable walk. We also took the subway (42nd Street - entrance near Wallgreens). While there, we watched a Broadway show and it was walking distance from Hotel St James. We highly recommend this hotel. It is not too pricey and provided all the convenience that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: r4outy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous, situated really well for times square and very reasonably priced. Room was great, clean towels everyday and room cleaned. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Concierge was reasonably helpful, but at times communication was a little troublesome, and they appeared to spend a lot of time on their mobiles to friends when we were stood waiting for assistance, which did look unprofessional, however, concierge is as far as i am aware not employed by hotel st James they are separate, so this in no way had an effect on the rating of the hotel for us! The hotel is excellent, a great place to unwind at the end of a long walking, sight seeing day. We would definatley stay here again. Thank you so much to all st James staff for making the holiday perfect after months of planning!

Reviews.Title: “NYC's Best Hotel and Crew”
Reviews.Author: Terrance81
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the St. James now numerous times over the past 3-4 years. We've stayed in plenty of other NYC hotels incl. the higher end places, but all I can say is that the Hotel St. James is BY FAR our favorite, most pleasant, most friendly hotel in NYC. The front desk guys are the best you'll ever come across. Joey and the others know how to treat people with respect and genuine personality. The Hotel St. James is "my home away from home" - it truly is a hidden gem in the NYC hotel scene (and I kind of hope it stays that way). The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The lobby and front and rear sitting areas on the 1st floor are very cozy and comfortable. Lockers will hold your items if needed before or after checkout. I can't say enough how I've come to enjoy my visits to the St. James - I won't stay anywhere else again in NYC. They've become friends who've taken the time to get to know myself and family personally and that makes any stay in NYC a great experience. We have two more stays booked already for this year. Hey Joey, see you and the rest of the crew again next week! Had a great stay in March - Thanks for everything. ..

Reviews.Title: “need ear plugs to get some sleep”
Reviews.Author: elads
Reviews.Content: Was on a working trip to New York, had 2 nights and needed a very well located hotel - St. James is it. Location is perfect! But... all the rest not so. Staff were helpful and nice. Floor makes noise when walking on it - the building is very old. Very noisy, had to use ear plugs in order to get some sleep. All in all, if you have a higher budget, find a better place. Free wi-fi was a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not much else...”
Reviews.Author: BelTraveller18
Reviews.Content: Hotel St James places you literally on the doorstep of Times Square and is therefore in easy walking distance of the main attractions in that area. But after your eyes adjust to the dazzling lights, you realise that staying at Hotel St James is all about location and not much else. The shower took, on average, 5 minutes to warm up; the supposed free wi-fi didn't reach our room and was even patchy when we sat opposite reception; the staff were cold and unfriendly, indifferent at best; and to really mark the occasion, the toilet blocked up more than once. Next time, we'll opt to stay off the main strip in favour of better quality accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mm0160
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just two nights. People helpful and friendly. Room clean. Would have liked a better tv and a fridge in the room, but the value was good and the location excellent! Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: curtisn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel St. James is a very clean hotel with friendly staff. Nice siting areas on the ground floor. The room and the bathroom were clean. But too many little things added up to this being a disappointment. The hotel's free wifi was either poor or non-existent, even in the lobby. The room's TV is an old 4x3 Standard Def. There is no room temperature control. No drapes on the window - only mini-blinds. There is not an exhaust fan in the bathroom (likely the cause of mold stains on the ceiling). The beds are very firm. No bounce at all when you sit on them. Sheets and towels were clean. The room door does not have the added security measures that are common in most hotels - such as locks that are controlled only from inside the room. When you leave the hotel, you're asked to leave the key at the front desk. The hotel is only a block off Times Square. That's great for getting to Times Sq., but the ambient noise level at the hotel is something to consider. We were on the sixth floor overlooking 45th and could hear the noise all night. Not so loud that we couldn't sleep, but I don't consider this a quiet location. And with no drapes, there is always some light leakage into the room. The concierge can arrange a shuttle back to the airports. Our shuttle to Newark cost $27 per person. Runs every two hours on the half hour, starting at 6:35am.

Reviews.Title: “Never more”
Reviews.Author: Lilicacat
Reviews.Content: sFirst we had problem with our name in the guestlist. I send an email to confirm the name, because they told me they can hold packs before I arrive. They send me an answer said that the name is on the guestlist. I bought many things in amazon.com and they rejected the packs as they arrive in the hotel. We talk in email about the happenings and they always try to say that they aren't guilt. I was very angry, because was an waste of time. They kindy (as they write in the email) put us in a king bed room (upgraded) but they are very rude in the emails, included telling me that I'm a complicated costumer. That's because I was very angry to pay for reshipping everything. The best room in the hotel (as they told us) was horrible, small, the heater didn't work well, as the water in bathroom, that sometimes was very hot and sometimes very cold and this happen many time during the bath time. They told that there is internet acess free to all rooms, but I only was able to connect in lobby and the signal was horrible. We find in our room a cockroach in the room in the middle of the night and we call the guy in the reception to take care of this (we are two women) and first they told us that he is alone, so he couldn't live the lobby. After my friend told him that we won't sleep with that in the room, he went to the room and asked us: "where is the monster?" In another day, we was in a pub and a guy asked us where we are, and we tell him the name of hotel, the guy told us: well, good night with the bed bugs, at least we didn't see this. As the others guest wrote the location is wonderful, but that is it. I never will return again and don't recommend to my friends, may be to enimies.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly nice stay..”
Reviews.Author: ddb68
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Saturday 4/16 at 3 PM. I am used to staying at larger, more upscale hotels so I was a little concerned when we got onto the tiny elevator and up to the narrow hallways. Definitely not what I am used to - it seemed more like a NYC walk up. We had an actual KEY to open our room door and we were told we would need to leave it at the front desk when coming and going - that was a first! And again, left me a bit unnerved because not what I'm used to. The room had very old architecture, same as the building. Windows with wood moldings and frames and they ACTUALLY OPEN!!! BUT, the hotel lobby was inviting, the staff pleasant, and the Room was CLEAN and smelled fine, actually, there was no smell at all. The bedding was a little old - but clean, and I checked all the way down to the mattress. The room was very cool and there was a bit of a draft coming in through the AC in the window but by the time we went to bed it was very comfortable. The room had everything we needed but nothing more which was fine because all we did was sleep and we did sleep! (It was a little noisy at times, but New York is noisy and it is NOT a huge hotel chain with sound proof windows etc.) They offer a flat screen tv and free wifi and there is computer access in the lobby. One of the best features were the lockers they offer in the lobby. We checked in on Saturday late afternoon, went to Madame Toussads(got discounted tickets from the conceirge and was able to skip the very long line with VIP pass), then came back to bed. Next morning we went for breakfast then checked out, BUT we still had plans for Sunday - the Museum of Natural History in the morning and Mary Poppins at 3. We took a locker and loaded our gear and were able to spend all of Sunday and part of Sunday night in the city without lugging around our gear. We all had a great time and felt very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel, but inform of the very authentic New York experience - you feel like your staying in a friends guest bedroom, not a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE, Your life may depend on it!”
Reviews.Author: eagleeye63
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at MANY hotels, timeshares, etc... COMPLETELY booked this hotel b/c of the Trip Adv Reviews!!! Was SO excited and very much looking forward to a special evening with my younger daughter. Unfortunately, a big mistake! Reserved for 1 night as we were mtg up with a high school group the next day. Stayed here solely b/c of LOCATION and so that my daughter & I could take in a little sight seeing and get a good night's sleep before mtg up with our group. Let's just say after checking in at 6pm, we occupied 3 different rooms by 2:00 a.m. The 1st smelled as though someone spilled a CASE of cologne, the 2nd b/c still at 1:00 a.m. it must have been 85+ degrees in the room. Getting settled in the 2nd room around 10:30, we went to bed with cold wash clothes on us to cool down thinking the 1 open window would eventually cool the room, nevermind the NYC noise IF you keep the window open. Completely unaware of good cust service, mgmt acted as though we were imposing when explaining not being able to sleep in a room that would give anyone a migraine b/c of the smell (originally told they were sold out). When trying to use the room phone to call the front desk at 1 a.m. to inquire about A/C, realized there were no markings on the phone to do so. Looked up the ph # on my printed confirm# and used my Cell to call the front desk. Mgmt stood in my room while my daughter & I were in our PJ's and told us that we should keep open the window (open since moving there at 10:30) and sleep with our sheets off. Yes, for $200/night, I did not know I would be told how to sleep. The whole experience frustrating and how humiliating to stand there in front of that man (in front of my daughter) and listen to his jibberish! Not at anytime did a staff member EVER offer to help move our luggage, bring another key to our room, apologize for any inconvenience, etc.. It was my daughter & I up & down the elevator getting a key to a different room, they behaving as if they could care less whether we stayed or left. Only the next morning when realizing we could not exit our room as the door knob would not turn and we could not get out, did I decide that I would post on Trip Adv (never done this). Brought to tears and sick to my stomach realizing the Hotel St James is a HUGE SAFETY hazard! There are too many other ridiculous details to share, but I couldn't live with myself had I not posted. A hotel SPECTACULAR for LOCATION but nothing else!! Mgmt hasn't a clue! Rooms were much of what I expected. Looking for no frills, only wanting a clean bed/safe spot as we were just staying the night. But really....no way to cool or warm a room? No alarm clock or phone to reach the front desk, and lastly but most importantly, actual metal keys to rooms in which doorknobs need changed. A fire in this bldg would most certainly be an absolute Disaster as no one could even attempt to help or fend for themselves (esp on 11th flr) Certainly hope the mgr at the front desk took my request to heart when she asked "housekeeping" to check into what I was speaking of. If not, I've taken appropriate action. Please know if you read this, I am a very fair person, but I would not allow my beloved dog stay here. And FYI, the Cranberry Deli next door did turn out to be what we read and expected, Fabulous!! :)

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, warm, friendly, very clean, and very central.”
Reviews.Author: the-vibert-family
Reviews.Content: we stayed a week during march 2011 and had an excellent time. the staff were all friendly and helpful. the hotel itself couldnt have been situated any better - just off times square. the bedroom was bigger than we thought it would be, with 2 double beds for myself, my husband, and our 16 year old daughter. the room was cleaned every day. the towels were changed every day. there is no bar or restaurant but that didnt matter as everything was literally on your doorstep - starbucks opens at 6 am and was very handy! cannot say anything bad about this place. well done st. james!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for location”
Reviews.Author: trsUk
Reviews.Content: hotel is a few mins walk from times square & not much further to empire state bld. the price considering this is VERY LOW and i would reccomend it. room clean, staff good, tv in room , bed good, bathroom clean, overall very pleased and defo reccomend. why pay LOADS more just for a bit higher class in same neighbourhood?

Reviews.Title: “MIssed airplane bc of the concerge, and never heard back from any manager”
Reviews.Author: yuls21
Reviews.Content: DO NOT!!!!! take any advice from the conerge , the russian woman downstairs. We missed our plane even though had no reason to, she recommended we take THE SHUTTTLE, that costs as much as the cab. And it took us a while to realize that the shuttle was going round and round picking up ALL the other people from ALL the other hotels, and made us miss the plane we ennded up overpaying for the cab and plane tickets change- trip gone wrong bc of completely UNPROFESSIONAL staff!! terrible!!! noone had ever called back!!! Unbelievable that they are even in business, what a joke!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: Heathershols
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, great location within walking distance to all tourist attractions and just a stones throw from time square and broadway. Rooms are basic but in NYC all you need at the end of a long day on your feet is a clean bed! Staff were friendly, guy on front desk was mets fan which created much conversation what with my hubby wearing a Yankees cap! Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kal_el84
Reviews.Content: You always worry when spending low cash on a cheap hotel. Fears of rubbish cramped rooms, unclean sheets and noise from other rooms. This was NOT the case with st James hotel. Make no mistake , its not the plaza by any means but let's face it for the money you wouldn't expect that, and if you're visiting nyc , time at the hotel is minimal. All we wanted was a cheap well located hotel that had good reviews on here. We were greeted straight away by a lovely chap , the whole check in process was smooth. Our room was on the second to top floor and it was massive! King size bed, lovely clean en suite. Granted the tv was a normal CRT and the radiator a little noisy, but all this didn't matter. Thr bed was so comfortable, and every day the housekeeper made it impeccable. The bathroom was cleaned superbly everyday with clean towels as well. The location is like thirty seconds from times square, and about five minutes from Rockefeller plaza. We always felt safe, comfortable and looked forward to going back to the hotel where we were greeted with a smile and had a spacious cozy room to stay in. If you want a no frills , cheap but exceptional hotel look no further.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: klaklitika
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to New York 2 weeks ago. We stayed in the St. James Hotel. A very great location. Room clean, free wifi..all you need to see is around there...All the staffs are warm and helpful.Strongly recommend St. James for your next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!! Great Location!! Great Staff !!”
Reviews.Author: MrsVaughan
Reviews.Content: My grandmother, daughter and myself stayed at the St James this past week. It was our first time staying in New York City!! The Hotel St James was in the perfect location. Blocks away from literally EVERYTHING we went to see and do !!!! And right next door is a great little deli with healthy snacks, a 24 hour hot buffet, and groceries. The staff was great especially Joey up front. The rooms were plain, but clean and comfortable. So what if they didn't have a flat screen!! We payed the same price for 2 nights at the St James as we would have payed for 1 anywhere else !! It was a beautiful 100 year old hotel that we found to be definitely worth the money. Would recommend to our friends and stay there again as well !! Thank you to everybody for making our stay so wonderful !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: MazaFin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near of Times Square and several tourist attractions are also close. Empire State Buolding, Rockefeller Center, MOMA, Grand Central Station can be reached by foot in a few minutes. We had an enourmous room for 2 persons with 2 separate king size beds. I've never been in a bigger hotel room anywhere. Room was cleaned every day and linen and towels were very clean. The staff were nice and helpful. We ate breakfast every day at the nice Cranberry Deli. There was some noice from the heating system but we had earplugs so it didn't bother us. We did not hear anything from other rooms or from the corridor. If you are looking a place in Midtown Manhattan with a great value for money this is a hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel, dirty, noisy, small”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: I just came back after staying at this hotel and the only reason I didnt changed hotel was because it was a package I had bought and prepaid at travelocity. I read only the good reviews about it. The only good thing the hotel has is the location, but then again there are many others in the area that I am sure for not much of a price difference, have better quality.
