We were looking for a reasonable hotel, but we regret staying there. First the room is super small, I put some inciense the day we arrived and up until we checked out, the ashes were still at the places I put it, the cleaning lady didnt even bother picking up some trash that was in the night table ( which only had one ), poor lighting, the aspect of the whole hotel was like dirty, the carpets, plus, it was so noisy, it was not only the guests there that will make noise all the time at every hour, but also the employees there wont mind that people were still sleeping and they talked loudly without caring at all. One day we went out and came back and our room was not even cleaned up. Also, no hair dryer, only two small soaps and one shampoo was all they put, the water was not hot enough, and the shower looked more like a hand faucet for a kitchen , it was not even a big shower head, more water came out of the basin then from the shower, plus there was so much noise from the street, is like it doesnt have means of isolating the noise, they dont have iron either, the tv was super low, at the bed level , so we could barely see the tv, since it was so low, to top it off, the bed was super uncomfortable, it was like sleeping on a rock, they only had two pillows , super small too and uncomfortable, no extra pillows, nothing. I am definitely not staying at this hotel ever again, and advice that anyone search around for other hotels that are better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl80Brisbane
Reviews.Content: If you want a top location within 3 minutes walk to Time Square and great value for money then this is the hotel for you. It is an older hotel with older fittings and furniture but it is clean and in working order. Be real though - Its New York and you don't spend that much time in your hotel room anyway !!!! Some of the staff was were very helpful others not so. No laundry facility and no laundromat close by. Good internet access.

Reviews.Title: “My daughter and I was very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: amandafrye
Reviews.Content: My 6 yr old daughter and I traveled to NYC to volunteer in NYC for Christmas. I found Hotel St. James online for $90/night. I couldn't believe it. I figured that it would be a dump with bed bugs and terrible service because it was so inexpensive. IT WAS WONDERFUL! The staff was so friendly and so helpful. My daughter just loved them. I am super anxious about bed bugs and dirty carpet and linen and dirty bathrooms. The bathroom was spotless and newly updated. The room had a new flatscreen TV, little table and chairs, comfortable mattress, soft blankets and pillows and clean soft white sheets. I thoroughly inspected the room, including the box spings, mattress and behind the headboard, for bedbugs. There wasn't a trace of bugs and the bed was in great condition. It IS an older hotel so the heat isn't always evenly distributed. That can be expected in new 4 star hotels. The room was actually warmer than most hotels. The last night, the heat was not working well and when I informed the staff, they were very apologetic and explaining in detail why that happens in older buildings. They immediately delivered several warm blankets, fresh out of the dryer, for us. No bar, no breakfast and no restaurant in the hotel but 2 amazing delis next door and lots of other restaurants. Staff at the 2 delis next door were also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_Moraes
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. James is perfect. Fare rates, rooms are clean, staff is very nice and location is excellent. If you want to visit NYC, I do recommend the St. James Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible location and staff”
Reviews.Author: mjwTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the PERFECT location and at the PERFECT price. The staff was beyond superior. The hotel doesn't have coffee pots or clocks in the rooms but have large flat screen tvs. The rooms have been remodeled and are excellent. VERY CLEAN! The hotel has a very European charm to it. The Deli next door can take care of your coffee and breakfast needs. For the price and location....YOU CAN'T GO WRONG! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: j0nah2010
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little hesitant about the Hotel because I had never stayed there before but I was pleasantly surprise, the location is top knotch. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms were spotless and the employees were very nice. There is no Hotel lounge for food but next door are nice places to eat and the Irish Pubs were wonderful. I highly recommend the "One More Pint" for a sandwich it was very good. I didn't like the fact that we had to pay for the lobby internet but that's ok. The rooms were small with no view but we spent our time out on the streets were Times Square was in sights view! I will definately stay there again on my visits to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: bazg1981
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was the cheapest we could find in new york which had en suite bathrooms. On arrival we were greeted by helpful and friendly staff who provided us a key to our room. Given the price we expected the rooms to be small, cheap and pokey but were pleasantly surprised to find that the room we had was large and spacious. However if you were expecting a room with a view you will be lucky as only a few select rooms face towards the front, the others either face a wall or in our case a small service yard, but its new york and we were anticipating this. The only notable drawback was the lack of heating in the room and small gaps next to the air-conditioning unit mounted in the window which resulted in a cold stay. The bed wasn't the most comfortable but was clean and acceptable for the price. The bathroom was clean with a good hot shower. There was storage for bags after checkout which costs a few dollars but is worth it as it was secure and you know that all your valuables are safe. The hotel itself is located a few seconds walk from times square which I was very surprised to find, fantastic location. Overall this hotel was impressive, it exceeded my expectations of a budget hotel. The only negative which was notable was the heating in the room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: davidpetrillo
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel staff very friendly clean service was great would stay again when going to ny also a great location really enjoyed my sta so close to times square and alot of great dining place thanks st. james

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, GOOD SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Matt_NY_28
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the bad reviews that you'll read here about this hotel. The St. James is an old hotel but it's a great hotel to spend a few days in. As long as you're not used to the Plaza you'll have a good time in this hotel. Right next door is a great deli that serves everything from pancakes, scrambled eggs and bagels to hamburgers and wraps. Can't go wrong there. The size of the rooms is normal (not small). Unfortunately there is no view in most of the rooms, but because the building is just a few steps away from Times Square this is a good thing, unless you want to be awake all night. And who spends a lot of time in their hotel room when you're in NYC anyway?? The radiator in my parents' room made a lot of noise at night. When we told the staff they immediately gave us a new room. Good service! The only comment that I have is that it took a long time for the water to get warm in the morning, and when it got warm it didn't stay warm very long. My parents didn't have this problem. Conclusion: Definitely stay at this hotel if you want to save money but also want to be a few steps away from Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great location”
Reviews.Author: brisvegas_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last leg of our U.S honeymoon. The rooms are very small and extremely basic. There is no iron, hair dryer or fridge which isn't so much a problem in the cooler months but might be a little problematic in the warmer times. You can ring the front desk and request an iron (no ironing board incl) and they will help you out. I have to say though what the hotel lacked in amenities it made up for in location it was close to everything and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Either way, your in NEW YORK CITY for crying out loud who in their right mind would want to stay in their hotel room...not me, even if it were 5 stars. In summary it had a toilet, shower and bed and room was nice and warm. What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: MOO411
Reviews.Content: We stayed here not too long ago and it was brilliant the location is simply the best 30 seconds down the street and your in the middle of times square, 10mins up the road your at rockafella, 15mins to central park and 10 minutes to fifth avenue and empire state building ! Dont know why other reviews put this hotel down because its fantastic, ok the hotel is slighty dated but everything in our hotel worked fine (shower, tv etc) and was clean, we had a window room which made is slighty noisey but not too much as your so tired from walking around all day your alseep as soon as your head hits the pillow. The staff where very helpful, friendlly and polite. There is also a great delhi next door called Cranberry cafe which is open pretty much 24hrs and they sell tasty food at a low cost. So i would recommed this hotel to anyone, fair enough it may be slighty dated but i would rather stay in the heart of New York rather then a fancy hotel elsewhere and have to get the subway in everyday, because in New York location is everything !!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: hmc003
Reviews.Content: 45th St between Times Sq and 5th Avenue - convenient to walk lots of places, and friendly Deli next door for breakfast. Room a bit small and no teamaking facilities. Safe storage $5 for luggage after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Fantastic, Hotel - Basic”
Reviews.Author: coffecream01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with 3 other girls, we all shared as we were on a budget. The hotel was ideally located, just a block or 2 from Time Square, the reception desk clerks were friendly and helpful and although this was a very basic hotel, it was very roomy. The room itself had a TV, power shower and beds, there was no iron, kettle or even alarm clock. The beds were comfortable and clean. it didnt cost a lot to stay and essentially you get what you pay for, which is the location. I enjoyed my stay here and even on a budget, i think this hotel does exactly what it says on the tin! i would stay here again if i was on a budget, and besides you are in New York, thehotel is the last place you are supposed to be! you have to pay for internet (which disappointed me a little), but the staff were great about storing our bags themselves instead of using lockers when we had to check out and wait til much later for our flight, the concierge was very well informed too. all in all not a bad stay. Amazing location, great value, good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roostermary
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 5 nights last week and thought it was a great place to stay.after reading some reviews i was a bit anxious but if you want a place in new york thats clean central and value for money,this is it.i stayed with my sister and niece and we had a great time.everybody on reception was really nice espically joey who really made us feel welcome!!!the room was spacious clean and confortable.the cranberry deli next door is really good!we luved their choc cake!!!if u would prefer to spend your money on shopping in new york than on 5* hotels,this hotel is perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “As long as you don't have extremely high standards, this is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: GreenPants
Reviews.Content: In October 2010, we visited New York City with a family of five. After doing a lot of internet searching, we ended up at the Hotel St James. Having read a number of very negative reviews, we were fairly concerned.. which was absolutely unnecessary! As long as you don't have extremely high standards, this is the hotel for you! What do we mean by extremely high standards? Well, the elevator is a little slow, the hallways are just plain ugly, and the rooms don't have a giant plasma tv but just a good old crt instead; if that does not bother you, you're good! (how much time are you going to spend hanging around in the hallway anyway!?) Continuing with the important things, we found the room to be more spacious than we expected based on the reviews. Every day, housekeeping cleaned our room and supplied us with fresh towels and such. There was no sign of bedbugs whatsoever. The best part of this hotel is definately its staff. Everyone at the frontdesk is very friendly. In particular, we want to thank Mark for all his help; we couldn't have wished for a better service! As you can read in all the other reviews, the deli next door serves a great breakfast. If this is your first visit to New York, make sure to get tickets for the hop-on, hop-off sightseeing tours. Also, make sure to get tickets for the red buses instead of the blue ones, since the red offer more tours for less money. Finally, there is a free transfer ferry called the Staten Island Ferry, which will give you a great view of Manhattan as well as get you close to the Statue of Liberty. In conclusion, the Hotel St James is an outstandingly located, cheap and basic hotel that has all the important things just right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location overshadowed by dismal room.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmelinda
Reviews.Content: The room was very dark; couldn't see in the closet at all; no ice; no kleenex; no in-room or in-lobby coffee; We were cold and the heat to the building had not been turned on; There was a hole in the floor under the carpet that created a trip hazzard. Overall very aging and not updated. Location was great and perhaps for the money some things could be overlooked. No heat and trip hazzard in the middle of the floor seemed excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy937
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in 3 years that we stayed at the Hotel St. James. You cannot beat the location. It's within walking distance to the theatres, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and great restaurants (O'Lunney's, Connolly's, Havana Central, and the Cranberry Deli) are all within a block or two. Since we were there last time, the lobby has been remodeled, and the rooms updated. If you check prices online, you will see that the prices here are considerably cheaper than anywhere else. We will definitely stay here again everytime we go to NY. It's great!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere. Not acceptable for New York... Or anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: Jeebarsky
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't believe the this place could exist in New York. I booked the stay online after reading about the hotel's great location and more. Yes, the location is nice. But location isn't everything in this case. My sister and I checked into the hotel, got the key and proceeded to the room. When I opened the door I couldn't believe my eyes. The bedding and furniture should have been replaced 25 years ago. The carpet was so stained I was happy I packed slippers, the night stand was chewed up, the bedspread was thin and 20-30 years old. the mattress was soft. For the price I paid - $262.00 per night, I was in shock! My sister and I decided that this room was not doing to do, so we went to the front desk to get another room. We checked the second room. It was bigger, but had no air conditioning - at all, not even a window unit.. We were told to open the window if we wanted air. It was raining and the room looked over the noisy air conditioning units from the building next to the hotel. This wasn't going to work. I was not going to stay this hotel; not at this price or in its condition. I called to find another hotel, which I did. The steely lady manager was not going to give me a refund until I told her she would not want me to stay her. OK, a nice deli is next door. You still have to sleep at night. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... Friendly staff ... Budget style accommodation ...”
Reviews.Author: Weston13
Reviews.Content: ... I was very nervous about staying here having read all the negative reviews after I booked with Expedia ... And looked at changing ... But another hotel in same location would have cost a couple of thousand dollars more for the 3 rooms we had for 5 days .... The rooms are very basic ... But very clean and well cleaned each day ... The staff were very friendly ( I know a lot of other reviewers said differently ) but I speak as I find ... The location is unbelievable and the next door deli does a better breakfast than 90% of the expensive hotels I stay at every week for a fraction of the price ... I imagine it would be warm in summer ... But for a very mild October was great ... Of the 3 rooms we had 1 was a fairly decent size the other two were small ... All in all much better than expected and a fantastic location ......

Reviews.Title: “Had to pay blackmail to check out”
Reviews.Author: Meemacat
Reviews.Content: I brought my teenage granddaughter to NYC for two nights to see shows and shop. The St. James has an odd system. They dispense one physical key to the room and you have to hand it back in to the front desk every time you leave the place. They re-issue it when you return. On the day we were to check out, we left at 9:00 in the morning to go shopping and handed in our key. The desk clerk never reminded us that checkout was noon. I had forgotten this detail, and we returned at 3:20. The desk clerk chastised us for coming back late and said we'd have to pay another night. I asked why he had not reminded us when we left in the morning. He sassed back, "because you didn't ask." Our things were in the room and he would not give us the key to go gather our stuff until I gave him my credit card. After some arguing, the blond woman boss-type told the desk guy that he could charge me $100 instead of the full night. He added all kinds of taxes to that - occupancy tax when we were not even occupying - and came out with $118. The only good things about the place are its location and the fact that it does not have bed bugs. The room was dark to the point that we could not see to write postcards, the bathroom ran out of toilet paper and there was no spare roll, the bathroom has no shelf or countertop to put things like contact lens supplies and such (we had to use the windowsill), the two elevators are so small and slow that we walked up the three flights to be faster every time we came and went, and with the exception of one nice guy at the front desk, the rest were abrupt. All in all I'd never stay here again. Oh, I forgot to say that when we did get the key and go to our room on that check out day, an Asian maid was in there finishing up her housekeeping duties and she was angry with us. She grouched something to the effect that we made her work late. I said I'd use the bathroom and leave immediately. She said, "no, no. all clean for next guest. no can use." Well, I respected her wishes and did not use it, deferring instead to the one off the lobby as we left. But it is interesting how they had another guest coming in and had already extorted $118 from me for that same room.

Reviews.Title: “Not new, roomy or fancy, but clean and very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Explorercouple
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a room to relax in this isn't it, but if you like to walk and only need a place to clean up and sleep this may be what you're looking for. Yes, it is old and the rooms are small, but we were rarely there. Nice little deli/restaurant 2 doors down. Great place for breakfast or snacks. Easy walk to Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center and/or Central Park. Close to Times Square where you can catch the Grayline Hop-on/Hop-off bus which we highly recommend to get your bearings and to get you close to just about anywhere else you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading photos!”
Reviews.Author: Felicity085
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent location, is quiet and has very good housekeeping, but we were very disappointed with the standard of the room and facilities. Room was small with an ancient noisy AC unit, tiny bathroom with horrible shower/sink with inground stains. Bed uncomfortable and also felt ancient. Desk staff were brisk, not particularly rude but not friendly at all. All the photos on this and other websites mostly show the small lobby area which we didn't sit in (who does??), and a room that looked nothing like ours. We appreciate that Manhatten will come at a cost but did not feel this room was good value (paid $250 per night + tips for housekeeping).

Reviews.Title: “It's ok but the service could be much better”
Reviews.Author: santos_eps
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite old but the location is very good. Despite being well served by a blonde lady of Polish origin (can not remember the name) there are two others clerks, a young blond and a "Japanese" man were not friendly...actually, it seemed they wre doing a favor instead of being paid by service.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: crossfitter
Reviews.Content: Based on the cost/quality of this hotel, I would opt to stay further away and take the subway into Times Square. I was there with my two grown daughters for 2 nights. The room was extremely small, the window air conditioner was too noisy and obsolete and the shower spray barely rinsed the shampoo out of our hair. The elevators are so small you could barely fit the luggage cart into them. The upside: The Staff were nice and helpful....

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capie1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our 4 day trip to New York City. Was a little worried after reading some of the reviews but we were not disappointed. The room are old, but clean. The bathroom was spotless. Our air conditioner worked fine. The mattresses are hard but you get used to them. The front desk staff are friendly, especially Joey!!! A couple girls that work the concierge desk were unfriendly though. ALl in all not a bad place to stay if you are loking for a cheap place to sleep. Cranberry Deli is next door..great breakfast. Juniors Restaurant (great cheesecake) is on the same street between Broadway and 8th. Times Square is literally right around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Run like the wind this place will give you nightmares”
Reviews.Author: dtchicagotraveler
Reviews.Content: While centrally located the room is extremely small. The air conditioner didn't work. The mattress felt like it was about 40 years old. The gentleman that came to work on my room spoke little English. He claimed t was fixed. Bring pillows because these should not be called pillows. We paid 350. I'd rather slept in a sleeping bag in central park. I have no idea how this place could get good reviews unless you were coming from a refugee camp. I'm here one more night but I can't end fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “rude behavior”
Reviews.Author: nana5California
Reviews.Content: I called to inquire about location and activities and the rudeness and short,abrupt answers should have been a warning when I booked this hotel. When we got there,the ;young men stated that he did not know when the room would be ready,"come back latter" was his answer and was trying to get us to move so he could take care of other people waiting at the front desk..For a charge of $300.00,we got 2 bars of soap and 2 unwrapped plastic cups in the bathroom. that's it!!!But the worst offense was getting home and finding out that they had charged the full amount to my credidt card 3weeks BEFORE we got there!!!!!!!!Room was clean. You also have to pay to keep your luggage in storage while you wait,I have never been charge for that before.....

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: loracnosnibor
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my girls to see New York but did not have the $$ for the Plaza :) Took my chance on the Hotel St. James. Well...... I am so glad I did. Large room and comfy beds. I loved the old New York feel to the hotel. If I could make any suggestions: More outlets (at least a little more accessible) and the shower temp was random and at times scalding. The deli next door was fantastic and The Perfect Pint was our best dinner hands down all week. I would go back tomorrow if I could. Staff was very polite, helpful and funny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: alvaro-costa
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for those who want a place to stay near the times square and the 5th Ave. The employees are helpful, kind, and friendly. The room is nice and clean. The location couldnÂ´t be better. From now on it will be my home in NYC whenever I go. IÂ´d like to thank the Front Desk Manager, and her staff, for the good times IÂ´ve had in my vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York City Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chaserwaser
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel. A block off of Time Square. Two great Delis located next door. The Hotel is older but is in great condition. The old architecture is great! Our room was spacious and the bathroom was large. View wasn't great, but we weren't staying there for the view..and in New York you need to be 20 stories or higher to have a decent view anyway. The front desk staff was great along with the concierge. Very knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had and their advice was spot on! We will stay there again without hesitation! The price for the location was very good. We got a great deal! Subway was two blocks away, easy walking distance. We did find that to really enjoy what New York has to offer shopping and eating you need to get off of Time Square and experience the real New York. Don't be afraid to do so. It was great. When we visit again we will stay there but probably won't visit Time Square much,would rather experience the real New York City. If you are visiting New York stay at the St. James!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NikkiGee49
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a week in June to take my daughter to New York for her 21st. Having read the reviews I was incredibly worried, and had prepared her and said it would be just a place to sleep and it had bad reviews etc etc. Well, i dont know what these people are saying, truly I dont. From the moment we walked in we were absolutely delighted. The hotel has been done up clearly and the entrance is just lovely. The reservation staff we found to be always pleasant, always helpful, could not do enough for us to explain where to go and where to find things. The bedroom was massive, and the bathroom was huge to. There was no problem with the lifts either.I have stayed in New York at plusher hotels and found the bedrooms tiny (i had to climb over the bed to get out nof one 4 star hotel!). I would recommend this hotel 110%. It is ideally located, a stones throw from times square, from 5th Avenue, from everything. New York is an amazing city and the hotel and staff at the St James made our holiday extra special. I will definitely recommend the hotel and will definitely go there again and stay only there. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: amitjkalra
Reviews.Content: The most ugly hotel I have ever stayed. The rooms were stinking. I tried to open the windows and they were falling apart. The control of water temperature in the shower was bad. Some part of hotel was still under construction. The lift was scary. Good part: The hotel is right at the Times Square and has good connectivity with public transport. There was a travel office. Assistance with maps, taxi bookings, airport shuttle etc. There was a regular cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “Dated...but nice”
Reviews.Author: Jrsygrl4shore
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for glitz, you won't find it here, but what you will find is a small but neat hotel. Our room was small, the furniture a little dogeared, but clean. The bathroom was especially clean and loved the bath/shower. Only complaint about the bathroom was there was no light directly over the vanity. A girl's gotta have light over the vanity! Asked for extra pillows and towels...honestly, they arrived within about 2 - 3 minutes. Disappointed in the tv...granted, we weren't there to watch tv, but you have to be in room at some point. The tv was truly old school, maybe a 17-inch tube tv, no cable and it sat on a low stand which made viewing while laying down almost impossible, hence the need for extra pillows. The true pluses were the extra discount we got by calling the hotel directly and of course, it's amazing proximity to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Only for sleeping in, so it's OK”
Reviews.Author: levets
Reviews.Content: Anybody complaining about the facilities or the furniture in the room etc have missed the point of visiting NYC. Just spent 5 days at this hotel and whilst it is very very basic and in need of an update, it was clean and the bed comfortable. Bathroom was very good. The staff on reception were very helpful. Cranberry Deli next door is fantastic and very cheap. Location of this hotel is it's best feature.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: harley084
Reviews.Content: The st james hotel which we stayed at for 8 nights was great!! we cant understand the poor reviews. if you want the best of hotels then try somewhere more expensive.!! the staff were fine especially joey.it was clean , we had plenty of hot water and the air con worked , with times square so close what more could you want? i asked for a hair dryer and was given one straight away.A great hotel to stay at we would recommend it with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest hotel...”
Reviews.Author: BettyS1
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was exceptionally polite, the rooms were below par. Only one of the elevators worked and it took 10 minutes for the elevator to make it to the 7th floor. The lobby was clean, but the floor was horrible. There were empty food containers in the stairwell. The room itself was not clean. The walls had some substance splattered and there were food crumbs on the floor (It was a Tuesday, so not a heavy vacationing week). The bathroom was spotless and the window air conditioner worked quite well. the bed was like sleeping on the floor with a blanket beneath you. For $250, I think it was over-priced, even if it was in a block from Times Square. I won't stay there again-- I'll pay the extra $50 and stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, Glorified Hostel, Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jes4247
Reviews.Content: One good thing I can say about this hotel is it is in a great location right in Times Square. Otherwise, it is horrible. The customer service is unlike anything I have experienced before, the worst. You can't keep your room key and must turn it in each time you leave the hotel since it is an actual door key. The keys are always all over the front desk for anyone to take. You can't have more than 1 person in a room without paying an extra fee. The furniture in the entire place is falling apart. The AC window unit was very loud and wasn't on when I entered the room which was about 90 degrees upon arriving. The bathroom was tiny but clean. You could only open the window an inch in the bathroom to let the steam out since there was no screen on it and the pigeons outside would come in. The 20" TV was on a cart that was so low to the floor that you could not watch it from the bed. The closet was so small that you could not shut the closet door unless the hangers were sideways. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone nor would I ever stay there again. It was a glorified hostel that charges way to much. If you have ever seen the 1980's movie Big with Tom hanks, this is the nasty hotel that he stays in in NYC. It doesn't look much better than it did back then. If you want somewhere for the same price that is nice, 4 blocks from Times Square, and has exceptional service; look at the Hampton Inn Times Square South. This was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights , as previous posting the Night porter is rude and treats all guests the same , my wife and i are both over 45 but was asked for $50.00 in case we damaged any thing! Not sure what sort of guests they usually get ! This was refunded at the end of our stay I would however recomend this Hotel the location is excellent and the other staff were very good There is a deli next door for early morning coffee etc as there is none avaliable in the rooms It is a good Hotel but one event such as the Night Porter can put you off

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: McHItaly
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel. Some detail could be a bit "seasoned" but the accomation is very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Rick02010
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel located between 6th Avenue and Broadway. Just steps away from Times Square, 24hour deli next door for coffee, food, etc. We stayed on 2nd floor which was nice to walk up the stairs rather than take elevator. Joey at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant. If you want to save money on hotel and be close to the action I really recommend the St. James . This was our 7th visit to NYC and will be staying at this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: angelee00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel St. James for four nights. I was shocked to see how close we were to everything. The subway is a quick walk away. And there is plenty of places within the block to grab a bite to eat before you start your day. While the rooms were nothing amazing, they were clean and comfortable. When we needed something, we just called the front desk and had it in no time. Check in and out was a breeze and the staff there will helpful. I would reccomend staying at this hotel to anyone! You can't beat the price for how close are to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Terje_Mork
Reviews.Content: Small and dated rooms, but very clean. Location is great; one minute from Times square. Wifi does not work on the 6th floor, but OK in lobby. Rooms facing street are noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: salty82
Reviews.Content: Well, apart from staying in the W on Times Square, you'll be hard pushed to find a hotel in a better location for the heart of the City. I'd say it is about a 2 minute walk to the centre of Times Square - if that. The hotel itself is a little dated, but clean and quite in the room we had. Some staff were very chatty, others not so much - but hey why do you go to NYC? To spend the whole time in a hotel? The Cranberry Cafe next door serves amazing food at great prices, faaaaar cheaper that the alternatives half a block away. Only negative was the housekeeper who broke a Â£50 bottle of aftershave, with the hotel not even offering me a dollar to replace - $20 would have been nice. Anyway, if I go to NYC again - I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: FrankDoorhof
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we were a bit worried about where we would end up. Trust us, it's a GREAT hotel. The rooms are clean, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the location is just perfect very close to Times Square and some great restaurants close by. Get some breakfast next to the hotel and than go to the city. HIGHLY recommended for the pricing they charge. and let's be honest how long are you at your room.... ? We are here to see the city and to sleep that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Ruprecht
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in NYC and greeted by an EXTREMELY unfriendly front desk clerk. Finally am able to get a room under $200 and am informed of a couple of rules. 1) No visitors allowed up to the rooms; 2)Must leave keys with front desk when out of hotel. Neither a big issue, except for the room I entered is one I would expect in a youth hostel as opposed to a business man's hotel. The room has furniture that must've been purchased at a rummage sale - worn, cracked - basically, in terrible condition. Lastly, lucky to have air conditioning - but yes, it's the old wall unit that used to be in grandma's apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: grimeinator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over the Easter bank holiday weekend and it was just what we needed. The hotel is basic and not modern looking but if you, like us, are more concerned about seeing New York than your hotel room then it is perfect. It was very clean and our bathroom was cleaned and towels refreshed every day. It is in a brilliant location, two minutes walk from Times Square with places to get breakfast right next door. If you do end up with a room facing the street it can be very noisy, so do take earplugs or request a different room if you are at all a light sleeper. You do have to leave your room key at reception every time you leave the hotel so be aware of this if returning to the hotel at different times. The hotel also does not have any safety deposit boxes or safes in the rooms, so be prepared to take valuables out with you, or hide them! Overall, staff were friendly and helpful, lending us a hairdryer and helping with booking transport etc. Very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Juanpi_Garcia
Reviews.Content: we like a lot the hotel. we will come back. clean and big room, very quiet. we slept excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a theater weekend!”
Reviews.Author: ironista
Reviews.Content: The St. James delivers a primo location at a rock-bottom price. It is literally steps from several Broadway theaters (Valerie Harper in Looped was 3 doors down) and close to many more and to the TKTS booth. While not fancy, it is clean, has decent towels and beds, and a helpful staff. I asked for a hair dryer and was handed a nice one, and when I asked for an iron, one was delivered in 5 minutes. If you use conditioner, hand lotion, etc, bring your own--the toiletries are limited to shampoo and soap. There's a Duane Reade drugstore around the corner for any other items. If you don't have a lot of luggage you might ask for a low-floor room and avoid the slow and small elevators. Of the delis on the block, Dunhill's next door was better than the Cranberry Cafe, though they're both OK places to grab breakfast or lunch. We will stay here again. We attend an annual meeting that is held across the street at the Millenium Hotel, and the difference in price between St. James and the Millenium covered 2 tickets to a great Broadway show!

Reviews.Title: “i would come back to this hotel every time”
Reviews.Author: gillyLosAngelesCA
Reviews.Content: times sq. is around the corner and acess to the subway is excellent. For the price you cant beat it for being in the middle of all the action

Reviews.Title: “Time Square was 2 blocks away”
Reviews.Author: seanandoi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather old and in dire need of repair but considering how cheap it was to stay there and that it is two blocks from Time Square, it was definitely worth the money and I would definitely stay again. The room that we got was facing the alley way so it was dark, but it was clean and got hot water. We didn't stay in the room for the most part because it was New York so the hotel room didn't bother us. However, from the room we heard the elevator going up and down all night long. I guess we were too tired from walking all day, so the noise never kept us awake.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: landon2009
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel for it's price and location. I was able to get a room with two double beds for under $150 a night, and this is right on Times Square. The rooms were small but clean, the bathrooms were small but spotless and the staff was (for the most part) pretty friendly. Not to mention that check-in was a breeze. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is not high-maintenance and just needs a comfortable, private place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the bad press”
Reviews.Author: chickRC
Reviews.Content: To be honest for the price of this hotel, what can u expect and moan about? In new york we only used it as base, to sleep and wash! we certainly didn't spend time hanging around the room, when new york has so much to offer!! I agree the reception staff are vile, with the exception of 2 nice men who worked on there, who were lovely and more than helpful, the others were very rude! We must have struck lucky as we never heard any city noise at all, but i would have expected it, in the city that never sleeps!! All in all a clean hotel, very comfortable, with excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: LWalsh77
Reviews.Content: We can only assume that the positive feedback above is from those that have a financial interest in this hotel. This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in, keep well clear. To start off with, we could not even get into our hotel room as the lock was broken, although a member of staff managed to eventually open the door we had to fiddle with it every time we came back, it did not make us feel very safe! The bathroom was disgusting that when we showered we got out as quick as we could as it was too awful to stay in there. Then when we picked up the sheet of material, what they called a towel there was a thick black hair on it, which did not belong to us! The bed was lumpy and sheets threadbare. This was such a bad experience that we got up at 5 am to go out, we couldn't stay here a minute longer. When we complained to reception they were not apologetic and very rude. This hotel is overpriced and although this is very close to Times Square, itâ€™s not worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “keep going back”
Reviews.Author: NEWYORKIreland
Reviews.Content: i love love new york go 3 times a year and always stay at this hotel the first time i stayed i was nervous because i read bad reviews about bed bugs an what have you but i was put at ease after the first night if your looking for a top class hotel then book somewhere else but the hotel its self is basic but your in new york your never in your hotel its just somewhere to drop your macy bags and to sleep for a few hours the rooms are old fashioned but clean the staff are very helpful and polite the location is just perfect a stones throw from times square two irish pubs beside you and two delis what more can u want.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: kjd62902
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel St. James on New Year's Eve. The place was very clean and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. It's a short walk from many things including Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and Grand Central Station. We had to go through security checks when we entered or left the street, since it was New Year's Eve and the hotel is very close to Times Square, but it was worth the hassle to be so close to everything. I can't say enough good things about the staff. Aside from being very friendly and efficient they were so helpful! I've been to Manhattan lots of times but this was my first New Year's Eve trip. The front desk clerks offered incredibly valuable tips about navigating our way through the streets with the other million or so people. Our room, not that we were in it for long, was very clean and warm. The bathroom was small but we didn't care. Comfortable beds and lots of fresh towels. There is a very good deli next door and two Irish Pubs with great food and atmosphere down the street. I'll definitely stay at the Hotel St James again!

Reviews.Title: “I dont recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ma3bela
Reviews.Content: The staff were so good and very helpful but the poor guys happen to work in a bad hotel. The room we stayed in was clean but smelling weird. The cuilts were poor quality. And the heater was making a big knocking noise every few minutes that kept waking us up.I thought there is some maintenance going on at first.I complained but i didnt get a good responce. We didnt get hot water for showering that easy. we had to treat the tap in a crazy way to have hot water out of it. The location of the hotel is amazing though. Its close to the center of the city (one block to times square}. I dont recommend this hotel to anybody.It does not worth what i paid.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills...Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: westie123_9
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC...we were a little worried after reading some of the reviews of the hotel, but we found our room clean, the staff nice, a great deli right outside the door and it was a hop, skip and a jump to almost everywhere we wanted to go. For sure this is a no frills hotel...if you are going for the hotel experience you will definitely be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, amazing value, Super!!!”
Reviews.Author: jess_hellard
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly is a hidden gem! We searched the internet for days trying to find a central, affordable basecamp for exploring New York. Not only did Hotel St James deliver on this level but many others as well as I'll explain... I travelled with my Dad (who has already left his own review) who is 60 and whose back has seen better days and my boyfriend who is 21 and not easily impressed! =) Getting there: We took a cab straight from JFK and were amazed at the efficiency of the rank. It's probably the least stressful way to get into Manhatten as long as you can handle the driving! This costs $45 (flatrate) plus about $5 for tolls plus tip. Arriving at the hotel: Even from outside the hotel looked spotless. We were greeted at the desk by Jay, smiling and very friendly. We signed some documents and took one of two lifts to our room on the second floor (212). The room was very spacious with two double beds, a large closet, long dresser with TV and coffee table with two chairs. The bathroom is very small but extremely clean and hey.. what do you want from a bathroom?! Both the sheets on the bed and the towels in the bathroom were clean and we had fresh towels every day, though we did leave about $3 a day tip. One tip: if you're sleeping in the bed by the window during the winter months, ask for another blanket or two as the wind does come through the window a bit. But the beds are very comfortable as even my dad (with the bad back) can account for! One other thing to keep in mind is that there is a bit of noise in the back of the hotel in the mornings from the diners next door but my boyfriend slept right through and I just put my earplugs in. Venturing out: We were out of the hotel at 8ish every morning so having two diners right next door was beyond helpful! Both have the most amazing variety of food for you to try, both are very reasonably priced and both are a great way to start your days. Turn right out of the hotel and you are about 30 seconds from Times Square!!! Rockefeller Centre was about 5 mins away, as was fifth avenue and Empire State Building was about 10 mins walk away. We took the subway to Battery Park to go to the Statue of Liberty and you can get a day travel card for $8.25 for the subway which is really handy if you want to get around a lot in a short amount of time. Other information: There are two Irish pubs on the same street as the hotel, we only went to O'Lunneys but can fully recommend the beer and the food (especially the super super tender beef brisket). There are about 4 computers with internet in the hotel which are pay as you go. They are also linked up to printers which were very helpful to us for checking in online for the flights. Check out is at 11am but there is a room in reception which have lockers that you can rent for 24 for $5. The lockers are electronic and are huge!!! We fitted in two suitcases, a large holdall, a large piece of handluggage and a rucksack! All three of us were thrilled with our stay at Hotel St James but if you are expecting luxury you will be disappointed. If you take it for what it is, a clean, affordable hotel in central Manhatten, then you will have a super holiday! Have fun! =)

Reviews.Title: “Break Time”
Reviews.Author: CliveW1
Reviews.Content: Needed a break in N/Y before our journey through the States, nice helpful staff, rooms clean and large, and the is a deli on the door step, alround good place,Oh and less than five mins from Times Square!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, fantastic, 30 seconds from Times Square & Jay!”
Reviews.Author: davehWales
Reviews.Content: MYSELF 60YRS MY DAUGHTER AND BOYFRIEND BOTH21YRS What a gem, 30 seconds to Times Square,JAY on reception a real New Yorker, made our stay fantastic, great room very cleanbathroom a little small, but everything you needed,the two cafe's next door to the hotel are great for foodtalk about choice NB.this is not the Ritz, but a bloody great hotel at a fantastic price one tip, please leave a few dollars for the cleaning staff, we left 3 dollars a day, try useing all the towels left in the bathroom, BUT best of all talk to JAY what an asset to this hotel, promote him NOW he deserves it

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Time4aRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: it's not the Four Seasons, but how many of us can afford the Four Seasons in New York in December! it's the best location steps away from a really good 24hour deli that serves everything and a starbuck 50m away, with Times Square only 100m away. I don't come to NY for the hotel I come for NY for NY and it's right on your door step. That said it's not a bad hotel at all, good clean upgraded bathrooms, a nice lobby area, free good speed WiFi, a bit tatty round the edges but I've stayed in much worse - I'll definitely be going back! (I'd recommend ear plugs though if you're not a good sleeper, but that goes for most hotels in NY)

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC great value hotel!!! Loved it and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: POB82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel St. James from 1 - 6 Dec 09 with four of my friends. We were all very impressed with this hotel. We were greeted by friendly front desk staff in a lovely lobby area, with relaxation area and web access to the back of the elevators. We stayed on the 5th floor (room 512). The room had 2 double beds. Very large room, plenty of space for 6 suitcases and endless shopping bags after a day in the shops! Small wardrobe and a long dresser, along with a small coffee table and 2 chairs made up the furniture in the room. Bed sheets were spotless, room was clean, bathroom small in size but what do you need only a shower/bath, toilet and sink!! Bathroom also very clean. Cleaners came around every day and made the beds, changed towels etc. We left a dollar tip each (so $4) every day for the cleaner. She gave us extra pillows and blankets on request. Location wise this hotel is perfect. It is right in Times Square, just down the street from Planet Hollywood. As soon as you leave the hotel are central to everything. Times Square is literally 30 seconds walk. Macys/Empire State Building/Madison Sq. all only 7 or 8 mins walk from hotel, 5 mins to Radio City and Rockafellar Centre. I cant say I can fault this hotel at all. I was a bit worried having read reviews about bed bugs etc. but I cannot stress enough how BRILLIANT this hotel is!! Clean, cheap and central what more do you want!! Deli next door (Cranberry Deli) is fabulous. Food is cheap and really tasty. 2 Irish Pubs beside it are nice aswell, with a good dinner in O'Lunneys. Would definitly recommend this hotel to both family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION, EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: butterflygirl938
Reviews.Content: Me- 25, Mum 61, My Daughter 1 year. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a lovely camp receptionist and went up to our room no problems- we were helped up the hotel steps with the buggy and bags etc which was lovely. The room was the size and standard of your average travelodge- so I was very very pleased. No tea or coffee facilities etc which was a shame but for only a dollar, you could have one next door at the fantastic cranberry deli. The cleaning staff were lovely and the rooms were always cleaned- new towels etc every day. Amazing location excellent value for the price. Would stay here again in a heart beat and would recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: NikeeT
Reviews.Content: Mt partner and I stayed at the St James Hotel for 8 nights in November 2009. Our room was on the ninth floor. (914). Room was big and very clean. We asked for a hairdryer and iron etc at reception and we kept them in the room the entire 8 nights and just handed them back when we left. This hotel is in a great location to use as a base to explore Manhattan! We also found the staff really friendly and helpful except the 'night guy' - he is grumpy bum! Anyhoo, the only complaints I would have considering the price range of the hotel is the room keys and the towels need updating - I found them to be old. Otherwise, for the price, this hotel was great. The hotel was always so busy - so that is a good indication of how many people are happy with the hotel. For food, drinks & snacks - there are 24 hour deli's, cafe's at your door step. I would stay at this hotel again simply for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “ENGAGEMENT / Friends Trip”
Reviews.Author: jstan022
Reviews.Content: So to keep things less obvious I was going to NYC to propose to my Now Fiance. We got a group of 4 to go. We needed something cheap and didn't really mind if it wasn't the Rolls Royce of hotels. The hotel is extremely clean, and service is wonderfull. We got a good rate a few months in advance of 89 a night and it was literally a block from times square. The lion King is on the same street and can be seen from the door of the hotel. IT IS ON A GOOD SIDE OF TOWN!!!! Dont let the price fool you about its location. Now as for the rooms. Be ready to have the bare necessities! The rooms are clean and there is good room for luggage and closet space. There isn't an ironing board so pack neatly and the higher the room, the lower the water pressure in the showers. If you are looking for somewhere clean, safe, friendly and efficient with a good price this is the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the experience actually made it a little more fun being you can sometimes get used to the "Usual" hotel amenities. There are lots of restaurants around the hotel, citi and bank of america, drug store, starbucks, and only a 3 minute walk to rockefeller center/subway station. I will return to this hotel whenever I go to NYC and I hope you will do the same. No need to waste money that you can spend on fine dining and top broadway which is right next door!

Reviews.Title: “i love new york !”
Reviews.Author: goredgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel St James in New York. (meant to write this review when we got back) from my 50th birthday celebration. The hotel and rooms are not fancy, there is no "contiental breakfast" but there was a Starbucks across the street and a Deli and Irish Pub/restuarant next door. It's very very close to Times Square and other places to go. We even went to a play at a historic playhouse on the same block. For the price I thought it was a good deal. Most people don't go to New York to sleep !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location at a very affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: busymom54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC for the first time to celebrate our 20th anniversary. We wanted to spend more money on the broadway shows and attractions and less on our hotel if it was possible. I read many reviews on Hotel St. James. The patrons gave it good reviews about location and reasonable rates so we went with it. We too were very pleased! Although, I can totally understand that if you expect to be pampered with extra ammenities, this is not the place for you. The elevator is very small. The rooms are adequate with a private bath. The staff was cordial. I got a little nervous when we observed a lady checking out of her room and arguing with the desk clerk about how her rate had changed during her stay. Ours, however, was prepaid though an on-line travel agency and we had no problem. Our rate was exceptional for being one block from Times Square! Outside of the hotel's front door are two 24-hour delis that had great breakfast foods, salads, sandwiches and snacks. All of the broadway shows are a short walk away. I definitely recommend this hotel if you just want a place to sleep at a great price and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirkybaby5
Reviews.Content: Positive. 1) Great location yards from Times Square. 2) Staff very friendly. 3) Good rates considering location. 4) Hotel and rooms very clean (tip the cleaners) 5) Free wifi. Negative. 1) Outside generators very noisy during night . We initially changed rooms due to the droning noise however our new room was also noisy.(A bit picky I know but if you value your sleep take ear plugs) 2) Our room 415 had an adjoining door to 414 and we could hear every conversation, yawn and burp from next door, so again be aware of this. Apart from the above negative comments my wife and I enjoyed our time in New York and would recomend this hotel for persons on a budget. We may have just been a bit unlucky with our room because after reading previous comments about this hotel , on the whole I agree with them, however we would probably try another hotel next time . Make sure you visit the retail outlet about an hr from the city. You can get a bus from the Port Authority station.

Reviews.Title: “Please Read This Review!”
Reviews.Author: FifeHolidayfamily
Reviews.Content: Hi People I stayed here with my wife and 14yr old son for 4 nights, I read all the reviews before we went and I have to rate the hotel highly based on our experience. We were treated like respectable visitors from day 1. The staff answered any questions we had and throughout our stay were fabulous, at no time did we have cause to complain. We came to Manhattan to fulfill my wifes dream, that is walking through the city that never sleeps, a little bit of shopping and to see all the things that this fantastic place has to offer - were we at all dissapointed?...never! I could spend hours bigging this hotel up but I will avoid doing so because my last paragraph will sum it up for you. 2 doors away is a deli - WOW!! pleassse go to the Cranberry we were up and out of bed for 6.30am each morning, Whilst my wife phoned her family I went down to get a couple of coffees and a juice, Britain could learn a lot from this place coz if is better than any cafe we have ever been to EVER! I am at the point of becoming too impartial with my praise of this hotel so let me hit you with the facts - Totally patient staff, help with whatever you want....I needed to use phone at reception AFTER checkout to see where our airport transfer was--no charge! I left my mobile phone in room and they arranged transportation back to UK..It cost me a few Dollars but they were fantastic with the service and honesty. If you need a honest and impartial review of this hotel pleeeease message us because it is great..... How far to Broadway 30 seconds... walking!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel and A great trip to New York city.”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaShh
Reviews.Content: Went to New York City from Nova Scotia, with 3 girl friends for 1 week, we stayed at St James Hotel and loved it. It was very small, 2 double beds, no dresser, only had a closet with 4 hangers, but for us country girls it was just great, we lived out of our siutcases, our room looked like a dorm room. We were not in our room for long, the place was very clean and kept clean every day It is am old hotel, and I loved that too , we stayed on the 12 floor so it was far from the street and noise. The Cranberry Buffet next door was a great place to eat it was open 24 hours, lots of choises, and very busy. We were so close to everything, check out the Today show at Rockerfeller center, Times Square is a 4-5 min walk. The 2 pubs on the street are good eating too. I have nothing bad to say about this place at all. We had a wonderful trip so much to do and see , We had the hop on and hop off tour which was a great deal. Take your own hair dryer, etc. We left our key at the desk when we went out and had not problem with security or theft. I would definatly stay here again. Love this place Nova Scotia girls.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing it has going for it is the location”
Reviews.Author: WoodyG11
Reviews.Content: Good location two minutes from Times Square - basic - no frills rooms - one overlooked some offices - we could wave to each other and another overlooked the street with a botched repair to the glass so a lot of street noise. It was a real shock when we got there - like walking back in time but once you get used to it and use it only for sleeping you can live with it. Its probably one step up from a hostel (No disrespect to hostels) Found the reception staff to be ignorant to the point of being rude and not helpful at all - the excursion person is the one to speak to. Good Deli's next door + a couple of Irish Bars - walk across Times Square to 46th Street there's plenty of restuarants + a good bar down there.

Reviews.Title: “DOESN'T UNDERSTAND WHAT ALL THE WHINGERS WERE ON ABOUT!”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkl0ve
Reviews.Content: I am very OCD, so after reading the reviews was very worried about what St. James was going to be like. Well, I'm here to tell you not to worry. Complaints to be false: Bed bugs: Not true. We were there for 6 nights and I know for a fact that they changed our sheets twice. Towels were changed daily. No hair dryer or iron: Both available at the front desk upon request. Elevators tiny and slow: Smaller and a little slower than usual, but did the job just fine. Rude staff: The staff were friendly and always had a smile on their face. No ice machine, no fridge or microwave: You can buy cups of ice from the deli next door for 50cents. We ate at the deli everyday. The food is cooked fresh and is absolutely beautiful, plus the staff there are super friendly! The noise: With the noise, comes the city & really thatâ€™s what you're there for. Rooms being small: smaller than normal, but nothing as bad as what I had expected! Complaints to be true: Room key: is an actual key, and you have to drop it off at the front desk every time you go out (even if itâ€™s to the deli next door). This did not bother us because it was better than us having to carry it around or losing it. Coming back in to pick up your key, you say your room number and thatâ€™s it. They don't ask for a name or any ID. This would be my only complaint. Word of advice: Donâ€™t catch the hotel shuttle bus. A cab to JFK is $45. Shuttle bus is $43 (not including tips) St. James is the first pick up point, leaving an hour afterwards of picking up from at least 7 hotels around Times Square. I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND ST. JAMES. THE LOCATION IS SIMPLY AMAZING. I WOULD NEGLECT ANY OUTDATED REVIEWS, AS THE HOTEL IS CURRENTLY UNDERGOING RENNOVATIONS. JUST REMEMBER, YOU GO TO NYC TO THE SEE THE CITY, NOT TO LIVE IN THE HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Seeka84
Reviews.Content: a block away from time square. Great location . Great little pub next door. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - basic hotel but great!”
Reviews.Author: vm019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in Nov 07 - I couldnt believe how close we were to Times Square - central to everywhere and a great deli next door. Lovely but pricey italian restaurant across the road too! This is not an expensive hotel but the rooms are big - very clean - and have everything you need for a great stay in New York - if u r visiting new york you are not there to live in your bedroom so basic is all you need!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: skinsler78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a pretty location - near the theater, shopping, etc. but other than being relatively clean, it was a not so good experience. The room had a iron burn in the carpet (I guess the people couldn't find an ironing board so pressed their clothes on the floor), there was no ice machine (I always thought that was a staple at all hotels), and the water pressure was about as low as it could get without dripping.The elevator was small and made too many serious noises for me to feel comfortable in but when you are on the 7th floor . . . There was always a large garbage bag tied to the stairs in the hallway. I guess that was suppose to make up for the lack of adequate disposal receptacles in the room. I would rather pay a little more and have a few more amenities. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant can't recommend it enough!!!”
Reviews.Author: juss3008
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a trip to New York and stayed in the St James. the reception staff were always friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is quite old but that just added to the charm, the rooms were an adequate size but not over large. Bathroom was a good size and always clean. The room was cleaned everyday and the towels changed daily too. Its location was brilliant and within minutes you were in the thick of Times Sqaure, but it was noisy. it has no bar or restuarant but there are plenty of places nearby to eat and drink, I would definately recommend it to anyone and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: claire277
Reviews.Content: My Mam and I visited New York in November 2008 and stayed at the St James mainly due to the trip advisor reviews. It is without a doubt the worst hotel I've ever stayed in and if it wasn't for the location I'd have to say this hotel has no good qualities at all. But the location was great, only 2 minutes to Times Square. The room was dark and dirty with a door which barely locked so we never felt entirely safe. The elevator was terrible and took ages to arrive and the corridors were dirty and very dated. On a good note the Cranberry Deli next door was fantastic for breakfast. Do not stay here, there are much better hotels in the Times Square area for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Super Cheap Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzzzseattle
Reviews.Content: Having to stay at cheap hotels for business is always interesting. The St James was a pleasant surprise. For just $150 a night, I had an amazing clean hotel room with a helpful and friendly staff. It is in the heart of Times Square and convenient to so many things. They had a printer and wireless was free. If you are traveling for a company that can't spend much accomodations, this place is awesome. Only bad part was the mattres was a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “What a disgusting place!!!! BEWARE - Credit card fraud”
Reviews.Author: blue_bumble25
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place - we checked into the lobby of the hotel and were given our room key. The room was DISGUSTING!!! It had roaches and was filthy and poky. The hallways looked like they had not been cleaned in years and I was scared to sit on the bed as the sheets were not clean. The pillows had stains on them like they had been used and not cleaned in years. We both got bitten by bugs from the place and were only there an hour whilst we sourced another hotel. We went back to the lobby straight away and checked straight out. HOWEVER, on our return home we have noticed that the hotel have charged our credit card for the entire stay and another nights stay as a deposit!!! On contacting the hotel they advised us they would look into it and get back to us. We are still waiting. we have had to file a fraudulent claim with the credit card company. I have been to New York on a few occassions and stayed at much better and cheaper places than this. The hotel we ended up staying in was cheaper, cleaner and friendlier. DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES STAY AT THIS HOTEL. IT WAS THE WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD. I WOULDNT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO A COCKROACH!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye16
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations at the St. James months ago, and after reading recent reviews were very worried about what the hotel would be like. We were there 3 nights and would definitely go back! It is certainly nothing fancy, but the staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, our beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was newly remodeled. We saw no evidence of any bugs. The deli next door is cheap, with great food. Location couldn't be better. I agree leaving the key at the desk is weird, but we didn't have any problems with it. If you are enjoying NYC, you aren't at the hotel anyways. I'm guessing we were there for 5-6 hours a day because there is just so much to do. The hotel is in the process of remodeling so ask for rooms that are on the floors that have been updated.

Reviews.Title: “great location but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ras81
Reviews.Content: the location is amazing it's pretty cheap for it's location. that's basicly it. the rest is midium at best. the rooms are very small and old. you only get one key, which u have to put at the front desk every time u leave, thus anyone can say your room number and enter your room, the don't really check the identety of the one that ask for the key - pretty scary.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: JamesB_Chile
Reviews.Content: Great location, on a relatively quiet street, half way between Times Square and 6th Ave. Subway station a block away! Rooms are comfortable, no frills, not particularly roomy, but more than enough since you spend so little time in the hotel anyway! No restaurant at the hotel, but with two excellent Delis right next door it doesn't matter much. Front desk attention is good but uneven: most employees are very friendly and helpful, a couple are a bit grumpy. Considering the price, excellent value for money. I recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: judith_chalmers_manc
Reviews.Content: I was abit concerned after reading the reviews left by other people for this hotel, but i got a very pleasant suprise! we had a room with two double beds, with lots of room, there was lots of space to put clothes away. i spoke to a couple who had a very small room, so it maybe pot luck, but i asked for a room with two beds and we had a plenty of room. the room was cleaned every day and the bathroom was always spotless! the hotel was on A Side road about 1 min walk away from times square, great location on the doorstep and yet there was no noise! afew reviews said that the aircon was noisy, it was abit but hardly worth a moan! it was the cheapest hotel i could find in the most central location. it wasnt anything amazing to look at but it was clean! i would definatly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank God I DID NOT cancel my reservation! Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FluffyPillows
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I contemplated cancelling my reservation several times. I was so worried and scared about bed bugs and the dirty cramped bathrooms. I am so glad that I DID NOT cancel. The hotel was awesome! There was absolutely nothing to worry about or even complain about. Checking in and out was a breeze. The staff at the reception area was friendly and helpful. Our room (1112) was HUGE. Lots of walking around space even with the 2 double beds. We had a room that faced away from the main street, so there was virtually no noise during the night. There was a TV with full cable, night tables,chairs, a telephone, shampoo/conditioner, soap, & clean towels. We left a $4 tip every night ($1 from each of us). Our room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels and soaps. But the best part of this hotel was the location. Just one block away from Times Square! I was able to go there every night because it was just so convenient. The subway, Rockefeller center, and the theatre district was all within minutes of the hotel. The deli next door had awesome food and it was cheap too! Everything about our stay in NY was made perfect because we choose this hotel. I have no regrets and would definitely stay there again! If you are looking for a fancy hotel, with plush pillows and luxury robes and giant flat screen TVs, then stay elsewhere.... but if you want a clean room that is close to everything, Hotel St. James is the place for you. We paid $179/night as opposed to the $300-$400/night that other hotels in the area cost... with all the extra money saved, I bought myself a Gucci purse at the outlets! Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “What a little corker.....heres the real DEAL”
Reviews.Author: simonsandrawelton
Reviews.Content: I have come to realise that there are a lot of sad people out there who would and do complain about anything. Those morons who complain about handing over your key....get a life!! Right here we go ....if you want a hotel that is a whisper away from Times Square, that has friendly staff 24 hrs a day, that has clean towels daily, that is spotlessly clean and is affordable then this is place you should stay at. We we on the 12th floor and as previous visitors will tell you New York city is a genuine 24hr city with the noise level to go with it, so being on the 12th floor was so peaceful, and we made new friends with the pidgeons that sit on the windowsill!! The Deli next door is fabulous and you can get hot food and coffee from 6am -12 midnight. Simply put a good, clean,safe hotel at reasoanable prices. I will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: shouldntdrive
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an overnight with a friend on the recommendation of another friend and it worked out really well for us. The hotel is situated about a block from Times Square so the location couldn't be beat. We got a rather large room with two beds in it for about $150 a night. It was a last minute trip and the man I talked to when I booked was so friendly. And it was 6 am. Not a small feat. Upon arrival, the check-in was easier than expected and we even got an early check-in. 11 am, I believe it was. There was internet available in the lobby and lockers for us to store our things the next day while we shopped before leaving. The only downside was that you drop the key everytime you leave and I thought that was strange. I feel as if anyone could pick your key up upon returning to the hotel. Bathroom was clean and room was not bad for a NYC hotel room. Could use a bit of updating but all in all, it worked perfectly for what we needed. If you're in New York to shop, drink and explore, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “ideally located”
Reviews.Author: TraMarie
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ideally located within a few seconds walking distance from Times Square. The hotel itself is very basic but our double room was big enough, very clean both bedroom and bathroom. Rooms are cleaned everyday and towels were replaced. Don't expect much of a view from your room but keeping the blinds down takes that away! Hotel staff were ok but could learn to smile and chat a little more, beware of the lady that organises your trips, etc she is very abrupt and expensive! On our return to the airport we used a private company, Dial7.com they were alot cheaper arrived on time and a really friendly driver. Don't be put off from the reviews of the hotel, at the end of the day you only sleep and shower there! Would recommend for a budget hotel but in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: jake077
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about staying at the St. James after reading some of the reviews, but were pleasantly surprised with our rooms. They were just as large (and bathroom larger), than the Sheraton Towers that we had stayed at previously. The rooms were clean and you couldn't ask for a better location. The staff was very nice and the Cranberry Deli two doors down was a great place for tasty, cheap breakfasts. Would stay there again. Ask for a back room, though. Our room faced the street, so much noise and light during the night.

Reviews.Title: “We had the time of our life!”
Reviews.Author: kenemly
Reviews.Content: I was worried after we booked our trip and later I read some of the reviews posted after we booked. We had a great experience!!! Our room was very clean. It is a older hotel. But that did not bother us. We were there for the city not our room! The hotel is 1 block from Time Square. It is a great place to stay, it is centrally located. And 2 doors down we ate almost every meal at this deli. Prices were great! We definately would stay here again!!!! Thanks for everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend the St. James hotel”
Reviews.Author: salsadiva2009
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the St. James hotel for 2 nights from 8th Sept to 10th Sept and when we came to the room, our key did not work for the lock of the door. They have a key to open the door and not a card. They had given us the wrong key to the door. When we got the right key for the door, it still didn't work and had to get maintainance up to fix the lock. When we got into the room, we realised that the hotel room window faced the main road leading to Time Square and was not double glazed for sound proofing. We could hear every truck/vehicle and emergency siren in the area of Manhattan. We was not informed of this when we checked in. A piece of the window was held in place by duck tape and got a draft through the window. Very unprofessional. Staff was not very friendly. I will not be staying at this hotel again. But if you are looking for something cheap and good location and nothing else, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLulu1984
Reviews.Content: Fair enough this hotel is not the most glamorous hotel I've stayed in but we didn't want a luxury hotel we wanted a hotel that was cheap and cheerful and in a handy location. We arrived early in the morning and was greeted at the reception by a very friendly member of staff. Our room was facing away from the main road and was very quiet at night which was nice. The room was small but cosey, I liked the retro feel of the hotel, very old New York. The tv was old fashioned but why the hell does that matter? We hardly had time to watch tv as we were out all day. The bed was big and fairly comfy, but we were so tired at the end of each day we could have slept on a cactus. The room was cleaned every morning and we got fresh towels and soap every day. Was lovely to come back to a freshly made bed at the end of a busy day of exploring. We had to hand our key in every time we left for the day but at least that stopped us losing it. We couldn't believe how close we were to Times Square. Turn Right at the main door and after a 1 minute walk you're slap bang in the middle of Times Square!
